ローマ字で書いた日本語
Romanized Japanese
ローマ字の手紙
a letter in Romanized Japanese
ローマ字会
the Romanization Society
ローマ字論者
an advocate for the Roman letters

content:
ろめい〔露命〕
〈名〉A transient life; a precarious existence

content.content: 露命をつなぐ
to keep alive―keep body and soul together―string out a precarious existence
彼はどうかこうか露命をつないでいる
He manages to keep body and soul together―makes shift to keep alive.
彼らは粥を吸って僅かに露命をつないでいる
They keep alive on gruel.
未亡人は針仕事をして僅かに露命をつないでいる
She strings out a precarious existence―picks up a scanty livelihood―by needlework.

content:
ろよう〔路用〕
〈名〉Expenses on the road; travelling expenses

content.content: これは少ないが路用の足しにして下さい
Here is something towards your travelling expenses.

content:
ろれつ〔呂律〕
〈名〉Articulation; utterance

content.content: 呂律がまわらぬ
to be thick in utterance―(子どもなら)―to lisp
彼は呂律がまわらなくなるまで飲む
He drinks himself thick in utterance.

content:
ろん〔論〕
〈名〉
1. (=議論)(抽象名詞に用いれば)argument; disputation; discussion; controversy:(普通名詞に用いれば)an argument; a dispute; a discussion; a controversy; a proposition

content.content: 彼と終日論を闘わした
I argued―disputed―discussed the subject―with him all day.
論に勝つ
to confute one in argument―have the best of it
論に負ける
to be confuted in argument―have the worst of it
その論は筋が立たない
Your argument is illogical.
事実明白にして論を要せず(論を俟たず)
The fact is too evident for argument―too evident for dispute―beyond dispute―past all dispute.
彼の成功は論を俟たず
He will succeed beyond dispute―beyond question―beyond doubt―His success is past all dispute―past all question―past all doubt.
論より証拠
Proof is better than argument―“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”
それでは論より証拠だ
Let us put the matter to the proof!
卓上の論
an academic discussion―a mere theory
机の上の論には用が無い
I have nothing to do with theories.

content: 2. (=何論、何問題)a question

content.content: 鉄道国有論
the railway nationalization question
鉄道国有論を唱える
to advocate the nationalization of railways
大乗非仏論
the Greater Vehicle No Buddhism question
廃娼論
the abolition of licensed prostitution
廃娼論を唱える
to advocate the abolition of licensed prostitution
征韓論
advocacy of the Korean invasion
西郷隆盛が征韓論を唱えた
Saigo Takamori advocated the Korean invasion.
亡国論
a prophecy of national ruin
亡国論を唱える
to prophesy the ruin of the country
君は主戦論か、僕は非戦論だ
Are you for war?―I am against war.

content: 3. (=説)an opinion; views

content.content: この問題については論が分かれている
Opinion is divided on the question.
委員は論が分かれている
The committee is divided in opinion.
そりゃ妙な論だ
I never heard such strange views.
彼の論は極端だ
He holds extreme views.

content: 4. (=論文)an essay; a treatise

content.content: 文学論
an essay on literature
Burke の美論
Burke's “On the Beautiful”

content: 5. (=評論)a comment

content.content: 時事論
comments on current events

content: 6. (=比較)a comparison

content.content: 両者は同日の論にあらず
There is no comparison between the two―They are not to be named on the same day―They are not to be mentioned in the same breath.

content:
ろんがい〔論外〕
〈形〉Out of the question

content.content: 僕の再婚は論外だ
My remarriage is out of the question―not to be thought of―I can not think of marrying again.
君の去ることは論外だ
Your leaving is out of the question―not to be thought of―You must not think of leaving.

ろんかく〔論客〕
〈名〉A disputant; a controversialist; a polemic

ろんぎ〔論議〕
〈名〉Argument; discussion:(=する) to argue; to discuss (a subject)

content:
ろんきゅうする〔論及する〕
〈他動〉To enter into the discussion (of details)

content.content: 根本問題までは論及しなかった
I did not enter into the fundamental question.
詳細にわたって論及する
to enter into details

content:
ろんきゅうする〔論究する〕
〈他動〉To discuss thoroughly; to make a full discussion (of a matter)

content.content: この問題はあくまで論究しなければならぬ
We must discuss the matter to a conclusion.
この上論究する必要は無い
It is not necessary to discuss the matter any further.

content:
ろんきょ〔論拠〕
〈名〉The grounds of an argument; data

content.content: 論拠を誤れる議論だ
It is an argument founded on false data.
君の論拠は虚弱だ
Your argument is based on flimsy grounds.
論拠を換える
to shift one's ground

ろんけつ〔論決〕
〈名〉Conclusion; peroration:(=する) to conclude (a speech); to perorate

content:
ろんご〔論語〕
〈名〉The Analects of Confucius

content.content: 論語読みの論語知らずだ
He is a learned fool―“A mere scholar, a mere ass.”

content:
ろんこうこうしょう〔論功行賞〕
〈名〉Rewards for services; distribution of honours

content.content: 論功行賞を行う
to reward services and distribute honours
戦役関係者の論功行賞がある
The participants in the war are being rewarded for their services.
論功行賞そのよろしきを得ず
The distribution of honours is not fair.

content:
ろんこく〔論告〕
〈名〉(The prosecutor's) statement of the charge against the accused; prosecution

content.content: それより検事の論告あり
Then the prosecutor stated the charge against the accused.

content:
ろんし〔論旨〕
〈名〉The drift of an argument; the point of an argument

content.content: 君の論旨がわからん
I don't see the drift of your argument.
君の論旨が明らかでない
Your point is not clear.

content:
ろんじつめる〔論じ詰める〕
〈自動〉To press an argument home; to drive an argument home

content.content: 論じ詰めると(結局)自由は人生の幸福である
In the last analysis, liberty is a blessing.

content:
ろんしゃ〔論者〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ろんじゃ〔論者〕

content:
ろんじゃ〔論者〕
〈名〉A disputant; a debater; an advocate

content.content: 論者あるいは言わん
It may be contended that.
彼は主戦論者だ
He is an advocate of war―for war.
非戦論者だ
He is an advocate of peace―against war.

ろんじゅつ〔論述〕
〈名〉Statement; enunciation:(=する) to state, enunciate, set forth (a new theory, etc.)

ろんしょう〔論証〕
〈名〉Demonstration:(=する) to demonstrate (a fact)

content:
ろんじる〔論じる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: ろんずる〔論ずる〕

content:
ろんずる〔論ずる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=議論する)to argue (with one about something); to dispute (with one about something); to discuss (a subject)

content.content: 人と何を論ずる
to argue with―dispute with―a person about something
ここの意味については先生と論じたことがある
I once dispute with my teacher about the meaning of the passage.
終日この問題を論じた
We discussed the subject all day.
処置の正否を論じた
We discussed the propriety of the step.
この問題は論ずべき余地が無い
The subject admits of no discussion.
もう論ずべき余地が無い
The question admits of no further discussion.
君と大いに論じなければならないことがある
I must have it out with you.

content: 2. (=評論する)to comment (on facts or events)

content.content: 新聞記者は時事を論ずる
The journalist comments on current events.

content: 3. (=問題を扱う)to treat of, deal with, concern itself with (a subject)

content.content: これは何を論じた本か
What does the book treat of?―deal with?
哲学は事物の原因原則を論ずる学問である
Philosophy treats of―deals with―concerns itself with―the causes and principles of things.
この問題はくわしくは論じません
I shall not dwell on the subject at any length.

content: 4. (=区別する)to distinguish (between this and that); to respect (persons)

content.content: 法律は人を論ぜず
The law has no respect of persons―The law is no respecter of persons―All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
電信料は遠近を論ぜず
Telegrams are charged irrespective of distance.→『ろんぜず〔論ぜず〕』

content: 5. (=眼中に置く、酌量する)to consider; to take (anything) into consideration; to take (anything) into account; to take account of (anything)

content.content: 学者として論ずれば彼は先代に劣る
Considered as a scholar, he is below his predecessor.
(犯罪の)動機を論じなければならぬ
We must take the motive into account.
人選には国籍を論ぜぬ
In choosing the men, I take no account of nationality.
階級は論ずるに足らぬ
I consider the classes of no consequence.

content: 6. (=論ずるに足らず、重要ならず)(it) does not matter; (it) does not signify; to make no difference; to be of no consequence

content.content: 価は論ずるに足らぬ
The price does not matter―does not signify.
国籍は論ずるに足らぬ
The nationality is of no consequence.
一二の差は論ずるに足らぬ
One or two more or less makes no difference.
他は論ずるに足らず
The others are not worth mentioning.
功を論じ賞を行う
to reward services and distribute honours

content:
ろんぜず〔論ぜず〕
〈前置詞相当〉Without distinction of; without respect of; irrespective of; regardless of

content.content: 老若男女を論ぜず皆花を愛す
Everybody loves flowers without distinction of age or sex―irrespective of age or sex.
誰彼を論ぜず犯罪者を罰する
The offence will be punished without respect of persons―irrespective of persons.
彼は誰彼を論ぜず交際する
He holds miscellaneous intercourse.
電信料は遠近を論ぜず
Telegrams are charged irrespective of distance.
晴雨を論ぜず会を催す
The meeting will be held regardless of the weather―in sunshine or in rain―rain or shine.
古今を論ぜず人情に変わりは無い
Human nature has been the same in all ages.

content: 〈接続詞〉No matter (who, what, which, when, where, how)

content.content: 事の何たるを論ぜず全力を尽せ
No matter what the matter may be,―Whatever the matter may be―Be the matter what it may,―do your best.
賢愚を論ぜず人は教育を要す
(No matter) whether he may be wise or foolish,―Be he wise or foolish,―a man must be educated.
その人の誰なるを論ぜずその言うところは間違っている
No matter who he may be,―Whoever he may be,―Be he who he will,―he is wrong.
時や場所のいかんを論ぜず賞罰は行わなければならぬ
No matter when or where it may be,―Whenever or wherever it may be,―justice must be fulfilled.
品の良否を論ぜず受取る
The goods will be accepted no matter of what quality they may be―of whatever quality they may be―irrespective of their quality.

ろんせつ〔論説〕
〈名〉(=新聞の論説)A leading article; a leader; an editorial

content:
ろんせん〔論戦〕
〈名〉Wordy warfare; a passage at arms; a controversy:(=する) to wage wordy warfare; to have a passage at arms; to controversy

content.content: 議会ではよく両人間の論戦がある
The House often sees passages at arms between the two members.

ろんそう〔論争〕
〈名〉A dispute; a contest; a contention; a controversy:(=する) to dispute (a point―with some one about something); to contest (a point); to contend (with some one about something); to controvert (one's position, etc.)

ろんだい〔論題〕
〈名〉A subject for discussion; a theme

ろんだん〔論壇〕
〈名〉The platform; the world of controversy

content:
ろんちょう〔論調〕
〈名〉The tone of argument

content.content: 新聞の論調
the tone of the press
各新聞は論調を揃えてその政策に反対した
The papers protested against the policy in the same tone.

ろーんてにす〔庭球<ローンテニス>〕
〈名〉Lawn-tennis

ろーんてにす〔庭球<ローンテニス>〕
〈名〉Lawn-tennis

content:
ろんてん〔論点〕
〈名〉A point; a disputed point; the point at issue

content.content: いったい争いの論点は何か
What is the point at issue?
論点を明らかにする
to elucidate a disputed point

content:
ろんどん〔倫敦<ロンドン>〕
〈固名〉London

content.content: ロンドン子
a Londoner―a cockney

content:
ろんどん〔倫敦<ロンドン>〕
〈固名〉London

content.content: ロンドン子
a Londoner―a cockney

content:
ろんなん〔論難〕
〈名〉Criticism; denunciation:(=する) to criticize, denounce (one's position)

content.content: 論難攻撃
denunciation

ろんぱ〔論破〕
〈名〉Refutation:(=する) to refute, confute (an argument)

ろんばく〔論駁〕
〈名〉Refutation; confutation:(=する) to refute (one) in argument; to confute (one) in argument

content:
ろんぱん〔論判〕
〈名〉A dispute; a squabble; high words:(=する) to dispute, have a dispute (with any one); to squabble, have a squabble (with any one); to have high words (with any one)

content.content: 彼は亭主と論判しておった
He was having words with the landlord.
論判から腕力沙汰になつた
From words they came to blows―They proceeded from words to blows.

ろんぴょう〔論評〕
〈名〉Criticism; a review; a comment:(=する) to criticize (a work); to review (a book); to comment on (current events, etc.)

content:
ろんぶん〔論文〕
〈名〉An essay; a theme:(一冊の論文)a treatise:(時事の論文)a pamphlet:(新聞の論文)an article:(雑誌などの論文)a paper:(試験の論文)a thesis

content.content: 卒業論文
a graduation thesis
博士論文
a thesis for a doctorate
彼は論文を提出して博士号を得た
He obtained his doctorate by presenting a thesis.
これは亜細亜協会で読んだ論文です
This is a paper I read before the Asiatic Society.
労働問題に関する論文を日本新聞へ出した
I wrote an article on the labour question for the Nihon.
日本美術に関する論文を書いている
I am writing an essay on Japanese art.

ろんべん〔論弁〕
〈名〉Argument; discussion:(=する) to argue; to discuss (a subject)

content:
ろんぽう〔論法〕
〈名〉Logic; reasoning

content.content: その議論は論法に合っている
The argument is logical.
君の議論は論法に合わぬ
Your argument is illogical―You are not governed by logic.
君の論法は誤っている
Your reasoning is false.
誤まれる論法
false reasoning
論法の誤り
a fallacy
緻密な論法
close reasoning
不正確な論法
loose reasoning
それは堅実な論法だ、不堅実な論法だ
It is sound reasoning―unsound reasoning.
三段論法
a syllogism
省略論法(二段論法)
an enthymeme
(ピストルなどを向けられて)その論法で来るならしかたが無い
If you use that logic, I must submit.

content:
ろんぽう〔論鋒〕
〈名〉An argument; an attack (in words)

content.content: 彼は論鋒が鋭い
He makes spirited attacks―uses incisive arguments.
論鋒当たるべからず
His arguments are resistless.
論鋒鋭利痛快を極む
His arguments are delightfully incisive.
鋭利な論鋒
an incisive argument―a trenchant argument
論鉾を鈍らす
to turn the edge of an argument―take the edge off an argument
論鉾を受け流す、論鉾をそらす
to parry an attack
論鉾を一転する
to charge front in argument

content:
ろんり〔論理〕
〈名〉Logic

content.content: その議論は論理に合っている
The argument is logical.
君の議論は論理に合わぬ
Your argument is illogical―You are not governed by logic.
その結論は論理に反している
Your conclusion is contrary to logic―against logic.
その論理は正しい、正しくない
Your logic is sound―Your logic is unsound.
君は論理を無視ししている
You set logic at defiance.
論理的に論ずる
to argue logically

content:
ろんりがく〔論理学〕
〈名〉Logic

content.content: 論理学者
a logician

content:
わ〔羽〕
〈助数詞〉

content.content: 一羽の鳥、三羽の雀
a bird―tree sparrows
鴨二羽
a brace of wild-ducks

content:
わ〔把〕
〈名〉A bundle (of wood); a faggot (of wood); a sheaf (of corn, etc.)

content.content: 一把の薪
a bundle of wood
薪は一把いくらで売る
Wood is sold by the bundle.
一把いくらか
How much a bundle?
五把ばかり取っておこう
I will take five bundles.

content:
わ〔輪、環〕
〈名〉
1. A ring:(円形)a circle:(子どものまわす輪)a hoop:(糸などの輪)a loop:(鎖の輪)a link:(花の輪)a garland; a wreath:(車の輪)a wheel

content.content: 輪にする
to loop a thread―coil a rope
環をこしらえる
to make a ring
花の環をこしらえる
to wreathe a garland of flowers
輪になって坐る
to sit in a circle
(石を水に投げて)波の輪を立てる
to start the water-rings
子どもが環をまわす
A boy trundles a hoop.
(タバコの)煙を環に吹く
to blow rings of smoke―(落ち着いてタバコを吸うの意味なら)―have a quiet smoke
車の輪がはずれた
A wheel has come off.
智慧の環
the puzzle-ring
輪を掛けて言う、輪に輪を掛けて言う
to exaggerate
(人の行動などを)輪を掛けて賞める
to paint one's action in bright colours
輪を掛けて悪く言う
to paint one's action in dark colours

content:
わ〔輪、環〕
〈名〉
1. A ring:(円形)a circle:(子どものまわす輪)a hoop:(糸などの輪)a loop:(鎖の輪)a link:(花の輪)a garland; a wreath:(車の輪)a wheel

content.content: 輪にする
to loop a thread―coil a rope
環をこしらえる
to make a ring
花の環をこしらえる
to wreathe a garland of flowers
輪になって坐る
to sit in a circle
(石を水に投げて)波の輪を立てる
to start the water-rings
子どもが環をまわす
A boy trundles a hoop.
(タバコの)煙を環に吹く
to blow rings of smoke―(落ち着いてタバコを吸うの意味なら)―have a quiet smoke
車の輪がはずれた
A wheel has come off.
智慧の環
the puzzle-ring
輪を掛けて言う、輪に輪を掛けて言う
to exaggerate
(人の行動などを)輪を掛けて賞める
to paint one's action in bright colours
輪を掛けて悪く言う
to paint one's action in dark colours

content:
わ〔和〕
〈名〉
1. (=平和)peace

content.content: 敵が和を乞う
The enemy sues for peace.
和を申込む
to make overtures of peace―hold out the olive-branch
和を講ずる
to make peace with the enemy
和を結ぶ
to conclude peace with the enemy
和成る
Peace is restored.

content: 2. (=和合)concord; harmony; union

content.content: 夫婦の和
concord between husband and wife―conjugal harmony
人の和は我れに在り
The strength of union is with us.
地の和は人の和にしかず
The strength of position can not prevail over the strength of union.

content: 3. (=合わした数)the sum

content.content: 次の数の和を求む
Find the sum of the following numbers:―
二と二の和は四
Two and two make four.

content: 〈形〉Japanese

content.content: 和酒
Japanese wine.

content:
ワアワア
〈副〉Noisily; clamorously; vociferously

content.content: ワアワア泣く
to howl
ワアワア騒ぐ
to clamour
群衆が門外でワアワア騒いでいる
There is a clamorous crowd outside the gate.

content:
わい
〈間投詞〉I declare!

content.content: この子は天才だわい
The boy is a genius, I declare!

わいしょう〔矮小〕
〈形〉Dwarfish (figure); diminutive (person); stunted (growth); scrubby (trees)

わいじん〔矮人〕
〈名〉A dwarf; a pigmy

content:
わいせつ〔猥褻〕
〈形〉Obscene; bawdy; ribald; indecent; indelicate; immodest; immoral; impure; improper; wanton; lewd; dirty; foul; filthy; smutty; broad

content.content: 猥褻な話
obscene talk―bawdy talk―foul talk―filthy talk―a broad story―ribaldry―smut
猥褻な言葉
ribald language―indecent language―improper language
その言葉は猥褻で訳すことができない
The word does not bear translation.
猥褻な絵
an obscene picture―an indecent picture
猥褻な本
an obscene book
(殊に女の)猥褻な振る舞い
wanton behaviour―immodest behaviour―light behaviour―free behaviour
(男女が)猥褻な振る舞いをする
A man wantons with a woman.
猥褻文学
obscene literature―pornography

content:
わいな
〈間投詞〉I tell you!

content.content: そうでないわいな
It is not so, I can tell you!

content:
わいろ〔賄賂〕
〈名〉(事)bribery; corruption:(物)a bribe; a golden key; a sop to Cerberus

content.content: 賄賂を使う
to bribe―one―corrupt―one―palm one―grease one's palm―oil one's hand―resort to corruption
彼は裁判官に賄賂を使って法律を曲げようとした
He bribed the judge to pervert the law.
賄賂を使って事を容易に運ばせる
to grease the wheels―oil the wheels
賄賂を使って人を買収する
to a buy off a man
選挙者に賄賂を使って運動する
to tamper with the voters
その頃は盛んに賄賂を使って運動した候補者があった
There were candidates in those days who largely tampered with the voters.
賄賂を取る
to take a bribe
あの人は賄賂を取る
He takes bribes―He is open to corruption―He has an itching palm.

〈形〉

You look young for your age―You do not look your age.

He does not look his age―He wears his age well―He is well preserved.
あの女は年の割りに若い
She carries her years well―She is well conserved.
あの女は恐ろしく若い
She looks wonderfully young―She wears her years wonderfully well―She is wonderfully well preserved.
作りが若過ぎる
She gets herself up too young.
彼は教師には若過ぎる
He is too young for a teacher―His youth is against him.
若い時
when one is young―in one's youth―in one's day―early―while one may

He travelled in Europe and America in his youth.
若い時は二度無いから遊べ
“Gather roses while you may”―から働け―“Work while you may.”
若い時は日に十五里も歩いたものだ
In my young days, I used to do my fifteen leagues a day.
(男女間の間違いは)若い時はありがちだ
Young people will be indiscreet.
若い時は遊んだ人だ、若い時は放蕩した
He was wild in his youth―He has sown his wild oats.
若い時は美人だったろう
She must have been a beauty in her day.
若い時は全盛を極めた
She was a reigning beauty in her day―a great toast in her day.
彼は若い時は利けものだった
He was somebody in his day.
若い時の苦労は買ってもせよ
The young should struggles with adversity.
彼は若い時に結婚した
He married young.
若い時に世の中へ出た
He was early thrown upon the world.
若い時は向こう見ずで前後を顧みない
The young are reckless and do not reflect on the consequences.
語学は若い時に限る
Languages should be learned in youth.

わかいもの〔若い者〕

』

〈名〉Amicable settlement; amicable arrangement; reconciliation; accommodation; compromise; peace-making:(=する) to arrange amicably; to settle amicably; to come to an amicable settlement; to bring (the matter) to an amicable settlement; to be reconciled (with an estranged friend); to reconcile, accord (a difference); to accommodate (a dispute); to compromise (a dispute―with the other party); to make a compromise; to heal the breach; to heal a feud (between two houses); to make peace (between two parties); to make one's peace (with one's enemy); to make up (a quarrel―with an estranged friend)

あの人の文章は込み入ってわかりにくい
He writes an involved style.
あの人の字はわかりにくい
He writes an illegible hand―a crabbed hand―a cramp hand.

content:
わかりやすい〔解り易い〕
〈形〉Easy to understand; simple (problem or explanation); clear (style or handwriting); plain (reason, etc.)

content.content: Macaulay の文章は平易でわかりやすい
Macaulay is easy to understand.
二つ三つわかりやすい問いをかけられてそれで試験か済んだ
They asked me a few simple questions, and the examination was over.
彼の字はわかりやすい
He writes a clear hand.

content:
わかりよい〔解り好い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: わかりやすい〔解り易い〕

content:
わかる〔解る、判る、分る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=解する)to understand; to comprehend; to grasp; to catch; to follow; to know; to see; to perceive; to make out; can tell; can say; to form an idea of (anything)

content.content: わかりましたか
Do you understand me?―Understand?
仰有ることがよくわかりません
I do not quite understand you―I do not quite follow you.
(なるほど)わかりました
I see.
よく聴けわかったか
D'ye hear?―Mind!―Mark my words!
もうわかった
Say no more!―Enough!
先生は早口で言われることがわからない
He speaks too fast for me to follow him.
君達は年が若いからこんなことはわかるまい
You are too young to understand such things.
もうそろそろわかる年だ
You are of an age to understand it.
何のことだかわからない
I do not understand the meaning―I am at a loss to comprehend the meaning―I am puzzled.
どうしてよいやらわからぬ
I do not know what to do―I am at a loss how to act―I am perplexed.
彼は何を言っているものやらさらにわからぬ
I am at a loss to comprehend what he is driving at.
ここの意味がわからない
I can not make out the meaning of the passage.
何のことだかサッパリわからない
I can make nothing of the passage―I do not know what to make of the passage―I can't make head or tail of the passage.
意味が判然とほからない、わかったようでわからない
I can not get at―come at―the exact meaning.
あの男は利口なのかばかなのか少しもわからない
I can make nothing of him.
お父様は英語がおわかりですか
Does your father understand English?
英語がだんだんわかってきた
I begin to understand English better.
だいたいの意味がわかればよい
You have only to grasp the general meaning of the whole.
道がわかっていますか
Do you know the way?
道がおわかりなければご案内致します
If you don't know the way, I will show you the way.
彼が正直なことは顔を見ればわかる
You can see by his face that he is honest.
あの人は歩きようでわかる
I know him by his gait.
あの人は一里先からわかる
I know him a mile off.
人の善悪はその交わる友を見ればわかる
“A man is known by the company he keeps.”
人は遊びぶりでわかる
A man is known by the way he takes his pleasure.
純金は嘗めてみると味の無いのでわかる
Pure gold is known by the absence of taste.
教育の有ると無いとは言葉遣いでわかる
You can tell by his manner of speaking whether a man is educated or not.
親父は今日中に帰るかも知れませんがしかとはわかりません
Father may come home in the course of the day, but I can't say for certain.
しかとわかっている
I know it for a certainty.
彼が米探だということがどうしてわかったか
How did you know him for a spy?
挙動でわかった
I knew it by his behaviour.
どうなるかわからん
There is no saying what may happen―Anything may happen.
彼はどうなったかわからん
I don't know―Nobody knows―God knows―what has become of him.
彼はどこへ行ったかわからん
I don't know where he has gone―Nobody knows where he has gone―He has gone God knows where.
どんな結果を生ずるかわかったものでない
I don't know―I can't say―There is no saying―It remains to be seen―what will come of it.
彼はせっぱつまったら何をするかわかったものじゃない
There is no saying what he may do at a pinch―He may do anything at a pinch.
彼はどうして生きておれるか僕にどうしてもわからぬ
How he manages to live, is more than I can tell―above my comprehension―incomprehensible to me―a mystery to me―beyond me.
彼はどうして暮らして行けるか僕にはどうしてもわからぬ
How he manages to live,passes my comprehension.
彼の心はとてもわからぬ
His mind is incomprehensible to me―a sealed book to me―He is an enigma―a riddle―a sphinx.
人間にわからないことがいくらもある
There are many things above human comprehension.
僕の言うことがどうしても先方へわからなかった
I could not make myself understood by him―make myself intelligible to him.
僕には違いがわからない
I can not see the difference―I fail to see the difference.
あの人はしゃれがわからない
He can not see a joke―enter into a joke.
僕には話の落ちがわからない
I do not see the point of the joke.
君には話の落ちがわかるまい
You can not catch the point―You miss the point.
お前達にわかって堪まるものか
I'm damned if you can see.
彼の気心がわからないから扱いにくい
I do not know how to deal with him, for I do not know his temper.
あれは気心のわからない人だ
He is an enigma―a riddle―a sphinx.
ようやく事の真相がわかりました
I now view the matter in its true light.
自分の行動が犯罪を構成しているこがわかりました
I now view my action in the light of a crime.
彼が失敗することは始めからわかっておった
I knew all along that he would fail―His failure was a foregone conclusion.
意味はよくわかる
The meaning is clear to me.
このキズは商売人でなければわからない
The flaw is only clear to the professional eye.
この道理はどんなばかにでもわかることだ
The truth is obvious to the dullest understanding.
字書を引いてみればその意味がわかる
A dictionary will tell you the meaning―make the meaning clear.
ちょっと考えてみばわかることだ
A moment's thought will make the matter clear.
考えれば考えるほどわからなくなる
The more I think, the less I understand.
この道理は説明をまたずしてわかる(自ら明らか)
The truth is self-evident.
(善い品だか悪い品だか)見ればわかる
The article speaks for itself.
どんなものだか見なけりゃわからぬ(想像もつかぬ)
You can form no idea of what it is like, unless you see it for yourself.
動物園の獅子を見たのでは野に居る時の堂々たる状態がわからぬ
From the lion in the Zoological Gardens, you can form no idea of his wild majesty when he roams freely over his native plains.
(見たことが無いから)どんなものだか少しもわからぬ
I have no idea of―have not the least idea of―have not the slightest idea of―have not the faintest idea of―what it is like.
話だけではわからないから現物を見たいものだ
I can form no idea from the description alone, so I should like to see the article for myself.
この絵を見ればその実況が多少わかる
The picture will give you some idea of―convey some idea of―the actual scene.
活動写真で見ると塹壕戦の実況がよくわかる
The kinema gives us a good idea of―conveys a good idea of―the actual scene of trench-fighting.
漠然とわかる
to form a vague idea of anything
戦争というものがボンヤリわかった
I have a vague idea of war.
説明を聞いてボンヤリわかった
The explanation has given me a vague idea.
彼の意を容易に察してわかった
I readily guessed his meaning.
彼の意をいろいろ察してもわからなかった
I vainly guessed at his meaning.
尻押しはたいがいわかっている
I have a shrewd guess as to who is at the bottom of the affair.
あれほど言い聞かしてもまだわからない
All my talk has been in vain.
よくはわからんがなんでもそんなことだ
I am not sure of it, but it is something like that.
君は音楽がわかるか
Have you an ear for music?
僕は音楽がわからぬ
I have no ear for music.

content: 2. (=判明する)to prove; to turn out; to be found out:(主格によってわかる)to show; to indicate; to bespeak; to testify to (a fact); to bear witness to (a fact); to account for (a fact); to throw light upon (a fact)

content.content: 評判が事実とわかった
The report proved true.
風説が虚説とわかった、事実無根とわかった
The rumour turned out false―proved to be unfounded.
この事実を見ても彼の無罪なことがわかる
The fact shows him to be innocent―testifies to his innocence―bears witness to his innocence.
人の顔を見れば心が判る
One's face indicates one's mind―“The face is the index of the mind.”
この行動を見ても彼の寛仁大度な性質がわかる
This action bespeaks his generous disposition.
彼は西洋人の家に居るのか、それで彼の英語のうまいことがわかった
Does he live with a foreigner? That accounts for his English.
それでわかった(道理で)
That accounts for it.
それで彼がぜいたくのできるわけがわかった
That accounts for his extravagance.
この話によって彼がどれほど世間を知らないかということがわかる
This story shows how little he knows the world.
この事実によって多少彼の人物がわかる
This fact throws some light upon his character.
彼に聞いたらこのことがわかるかも知れぬ
He may throw light upon the matter.
いまにわかる(時がたてば事実が判明する)
Time will show.
身元がわかる
to be identified
溺死者の身元がまだわからない
The drowned body is not yet identified.
良家の娘とわかった
She has been identified as the daughter of a respectable family.

content: 3. (=現れる、発見される、確められる)to show itself; to be found; to be discovered; to be ascertained; to become known; to come to light

content.content: 天才は幼い時からわかる
Genius will show itself―assert itself―at an early age.
惚れたのは素振りでわかる
Love shows itself―betrays itself―in one's look and manner.
この事実がどうしてわかったか
How did this fact become known?―come to light?
偶然わかった
It became known by chance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Chance brought it to light.
事実が容易にわかった
The fact was readily ascertained.
会計検査によって会計の不正なことがわかった
The audit has brought the dishonesty of the treasurer to light.
泥棒がわかった
The thief has been discovered.
彼が泥棒だということがやっとわかった
I now find him to have been the thief.
紛失した書類がとうとうわかりません
I have been unable to find the missing papers.
悪いことをするとわかる
An evil deed will be found out―“Murder will out.”
君はこの金を取っても誰にもわかりはせぬ
If you take the money, nobody will be the wiser.
事実がそろそろわかってきた
The truth is dawning upon my mind.
今頃はそろそろわかったろう
The truth must have dawned upon his mind by this.
雪で道がわからない
The snow has obliterated the path.
日数がたっているから跡がわかるまい
The traces must have been obliterated, as days have gone by.
あの婦人は年がわからない(曖昧な年だ)
She is of a non-committal age.

content: 4. (=区別する)to distinguish (one thing from another); to know (one thing from another); can tell (one thing from another)

content.content: 英国人と米国人はどこでわかるか
How do you know an Englishman from an American?―How can you tell an Englishman from an American?
言葉遣いでわかる
You can tell by the way they speak English.
食える茸と食えない茸はどこでわかるか
How do you know―How can you tell―a good mushroom from a bad one?
縦に裂いてみるとわかる
One can tell by the way they split, or do not split, from end to end.
匂いでもわかる
One can also tell by their smell.
牡と牝は大きさでわかるか
You can tell the male from the female by their size.

content: 5. (=事理を解する)to have sense; to be sensible

content.content: 彼はわけがわかっている、なかなか話がわかる
He has good sense―He is quite sensible―He knows what's what.
わけのわかった男だ
He is a sensible fellow―a man of sense.
わけのわからない男だ
He lacks sense.
君はもう少しわけがわかっているかと思った
I gave you credit for more sense.
わかったことを言う
to talk sense
わけのわからないことを言う
to talk nonsense―talk jargon―talk gibberish
そう言えば話がわかる
Now you are talking sense.
彼は道理のわかる人間だ
He will listen to reason―He is reasonable―amenable be reason―open to conviction.
お前は道理のわからない男だ
You will not listen to reason―You are unreasonable―impervious to reason.

content: 6. (=認める)to recognize; to know

content.content: 彼がその溺死体を見たら己が息子とわかった
He recognized his own son in the drowned body.
頸の黒子{ほくろ}で息子だということがわかった
He recognized his son by a mole on his neck.
君は道で逢ったらわからないほど変わった
I should not know you if I met you in the streets.
生みの母にもわかるまい
His own mother would not know him.
子どもの時分かれたのだから今逢ってもわかるまい
I shall perhaps not know him, for I have not seen him since he was a child.
暗くて自分の家がわからなかった
I did not recognize my own house in the dark.
あの声は確かにあなたとわかりました
I recognized the voice as yours.
彼はわからないほど変わっている
He is changed beyond recognition.
彼は誰だかわからないほどメチャメチャに殴られた
He was thrashed beyond recognition.

content: 7. (=鑑定する)to be judge of (swords); to be a connoisseur of (paintings, etc.)

content.content: 君は刀剣がわかるか
Are you a judge of swords?
あの人は書画がわかる
He is a connoisseur of paintings.
僕は骨董はわからぬ
I am no judge of curios.

content: 8. (=発表される)to be published; to be made known

content.content: 試験の成績はいつわかりますか
When shall we know the result of the examination?
当選者はわかったか
Are the names of the successful candidates published?―Is the result of the election known?

content: 9. (=味がわかる)to appreciate; to know

content.content: 君は英詩がわかるか
Can you appreciate English poetry?
君には貧乏の味がわかるか
You do not know what it is to be poor―You are a stranger to poverty.
貧乏の味も借金の味もわかっている
I know what it is to be poor and in debt―I am no stranger to the bitterness of poverty.

content: 10. (=消息がわかる)to be heard of

content.content: 出征軍人のことはどこへ行って聞けばわかりますか
Where are the men at the front to be heard of?
あの人の移動は学校へ行って聞けばわかる
He is to be heard of at the school.

content: 11. (=用がわかる)to understand (the business)

content.content: 君で用がわかるか
Can you attend to my business?
私は代理ですからご用がわかります
I can attend to your business in place of my principal.
私は小僧ですからご用はわかりません
I am only a shop-boy, and can give you no answer.
君は英語で用がわかるか
Can you make yourself understood in English?

content: 12. (=無いことがわかる)to notice the absence; to miss; to be missed

content.content: 彼が居ないことはその時はわからなかった
I did not notice his absence―I did not miss him―at the time.
宝石がこんなにたくさんあるから一つ二つ無くなったとてわかりはせぬ
There are so many gems that one or two would not be missed.
あんなに大勢居たから十人や二十人抜けたとてわかりはしなかったろう
There were so many of them that ten or twenty would not have been missed.

content:

〈自動〉

仰有ることがよくわかりません
I do not quite understand you―I do not quite follow you.

I see.
よく聴けわかったか

もうわかった

彼の心はとてもわからぬ

content: 2. (=判明する)to prove; to turn out; to be found out:(主格によってわかる)to show; to indicate; to bespeak; to testify to (a fact); to bear witness to (a fact); to account for (a fact); to throw light upon (a fact)

content.content: 評判が事実とわかった

This action bespeaks his generous disposition.
彼は西洋人の家に居るのか、それで彼の英語のうまいことがわかった
Does he live with a foreigner? That accounts for his English.
それでわかった(道理で)
That accounts for it.
それで彼がぜいたくのできるわけがわかった
That accounts for his extravagance.
この話によって彼がどれほど世間を知らないかということがわかる
This story shows how little he knows the world.
この事実によって多少彼の人物がわかる
This fact throws some light upon his character.
彼に聞いたらこのことがわかるかも知れぬ
He may throw light upon the matter.
いまにわかる(時がたてば事実が判明する)
Time will show.
身元がわかる
to be identified
溺死者の身元がまだわからない
The drowned body is not yet identified.
良家の娘とわかった
She has been identified as the daughter of a respectable family.

content: 3. (=現れる、発見される、確められる)to show itself; to be found; to be discovered; to be ascertained; to become known; to come to light

content.content: 天才は幼い時からわかる
Genius will show itself―assert itself―at an early age.
惚れたのは素振りでわかる
Love shows itself―betrays itself―in one's look and manner.
この事実がどうしてわかったか
How did this fact become known?―come to light?
偶然わかった
It became known by chance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Chance brought it to light.
事実が容易にわかった
The fact was readily ascertained.
会計検査によって会計の不正なことがわかった
The audit has brought the dishonesty of the treasurer to light.
泥棒がわかった
The thief has been discovered.
彼が泥棒だということがやっとわかった
I now find him to have been the thief.
紛失した書類がとうとうわかりません
I have been unable to find the missing papers.
悪いことをするとわかる
An evil deed will be found out―“Murder will out.”
君はこの金を取っても誰にもわかりはせぬ
If you take the money, nobody will be the wiser.
事実がそろそろわかってきた
The truth is dawning upon my mind.
今頃はそろそろわかったろう
The truth must have dawned upon his mind by this.
雪で道がわからない
The snow has obliterated the path.
日数がたっているから跡がわかるまい
The traces must have been obliterated, as days have gone by.
あの婦人は年がわからない(曖昧な年だ)
She is of a non-committal age.

content: 4. (=区別する)to distinguish (one thing from another); to know (one thing from another); can tell (one thing from another)

content.content: 英国人と米国人はどこでわかるか
How do you know an Englishman from an American?―How can you tell an Englishman from an American?
言葉遣いでわかる
You can tell by the way they speak English.
食える茸と食えない茸はどこでわかるか
How do you know―How can you tell―a good mushroom from a bad one?
縦に裂いてみるとわかる
One can tell by the way they split, or do not split, from end to end.
匂いでもわかる
One can also tell by their smell.
牡と牝は大きさでわかるか
You can tell the male from the female by their size.

content: 5. (=事理を解する)to have sense; to be sensible

content.content: 彼はわけがわかっている、なかなか話がわかる
He has good sense―He is quite sensible―He knows what's what.
わけのわかった男だ
He is a sensible fellow―a man of sense.
わけのわからない男だ
He lacks sense.
君はもう少しわけがわかっているかと思った
I gave you credit for more sense.
わかったことを言う
to talk sense
わけのわからないことを言う
to talk nonsense―talk jargon―talk gibberish
そう言えば話がわかる
Now you are talking sense.
彼は道理のわかる人間だ
He will listen to reason―He is reasonable―amenable be reason―open to conviction.
お前は道理のわからない男だ
You will not listen to reason―You are unreasonable―impervious to reason.

content: 6. (=認める)to recognize; to know

content.content: 彼がその溺死体を見たら己が息子とわかった
He recognized his own son in the drowned body.
頸の黒子{ほくろ}で息子だということがわかった
He recognized his son by a mole on his neck.
君は道で逢ったらわからないほど変わった
I should not know you if I met you in the streets.
生みの母にもわかるまい
His own mother would not know him.
子どもの時分かれたのだから今逢ってもわかるまい
I shall perhaps not know him, for I have not seen him since he was a child.
暗くて自分の家がわからなかった
I did not recognize my own house in the dark.
あの声は確かにあなたとわかりました
I recognized the voice as yours.
彼はわからないほど変わっている
He is changed beyond recognition.
彼は誰だかわからないほどメチャメチャに殴られた
He was thrashed beyond recognition.

content: 7. (=鑑定する)to be judge of (swords); to be a connoisseur of (paintings, etc.)

content.content: 君は刀剣がわかるか
Are you a judge of swords?
あの人は書画がわかる
He is a connoisseur of paintings.
僕は骨董はわからぬ
I am no judge of curios.

content: 8. (=発表される)to be published; to be made known

content.content: 試験の成績はいつわかりますか
When shall we know the result of the examination?
当選者はわかったか
Are the names of the successful candidates published?―Is the result of the election known?

content: 9. (=味がわかる)to appreciate; to know

content.content: 君は英詩がわかるか
Can you appreciate English poetry?
君には貧乏の味がわかるか
You do not know what it is to be poor―You are a stranger to poverty.
貧乏の味も借金の味もわかっている
I know what it is to be poor and in debt―I am no stranger to the bitterness of poverty.

content: 10. (=消息がわかる)to be heard of

content.content: 出征軍人のことはどこへ行って聞けばわかりますか
Where are the men at the front to be heard of?
あの人の移動は学校へ行って聞けばわかる
He is to be heard of at the school.

content: 11. (=用がわかる)to understand (the business)

content.content: 君で用がわかるか
Can you attend to my business?
私は代理ですからご用がわかります
I can attend to your business in place of my principal.
私は小僧ですからご用はわかりません
I am only a shop-boy, and can give you no answer.
君は英語で用がわかるか
Can you make yourself understood in English?

content: 12. (=無いことがわかる)to notice the absence; to miss; to be missed

content.content: 彼が居ないことはその時はわからなかった
I did not notice his absence―I did not miss him―at the time.
宝石がこんなにたくさんあるから一つ二つ無くなったとてわかりはせぬ
There are so many gems that one or two would not be missed.
あんなに大勢居たから十人や二十人抜けたとてわかりはしなかったろう
There were so many of them that ten or twenty would not have been missed.

content:
わかる〔解る、判る、分る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=解する)to understand; to comprehend; to grasp; to catch; to follow; to know; to see; to perceive; to make out; can tell; can say; to form an idea of (anything)

content.content: わかりましたか
Do you understand me?―Understand?
仰有ることがよくわかりません
I do not quite understand you―I do not quite follow you.
(なるほど)わかりました
I see.
よく聴けわかったか
D'ye hear?―Mind!―Mark my words!
もうわかった
Say no more!―Enough!
先生は早口で言われることがわからない
He speaks too fast for me to follow him.
君達は年が若いからこんなことはわかるまい
You are too young to understand such things.
もうそろそろわかる年だ
You are of an age to understand it.
何のことだかわからない
I do not understand the meaning―I am at a loss to comprehend the meaning―I am puzzled.
どうしてよいやらわからぬ
I do not know what to do―I am at a loss how to act―I am perplexed.
彼は何を言っているものやらさらにわからぬ
I am at a loss to comprehend what he is driving at.
ここの意味がわからない
I can not make out the meaning of the passage.
何のことだかサッパリわからない
I can make nothing of the passage―I do not know what to make of the passage―I can't make head or tail of the passage.
意味が判然とほからない、わかったようでわからない
I can not get at―come at―the exact meaning.
あの男は利口なのかばかなのか少しもわからない
I can make nothing of him.
お父様は英語がおわかりですか
Does your father understand English?
英語がだんだんわかってきた
I begin to understand English better.
だいたいの意味がわかればよい
You have only to grasp the general meaning of the whole.
道がわかっていますか
Do you know the way?
道がおわかりなければご案内致します
If you don't know the way, I will show you the way.
彼が正直なことは顔を見ればわかる
You can see by his face that he is honest.
あの人は歩きようでわかる
I know him by his gait.
あの人は一里先からわかる
I know him a mile off.
人の善悪はその交わる友を見ればわかる
“A man is known by the company he keeps.”
人は遊びぶりでわかる
A man is known by the way he takes his pleasure.
純金は嘗めてみると味の無いのでわかる
Pure gold is known by the absence of taste.
教育の有ると無いとは言葉遣いでわかる
You can tell by his manner of speaking whether a man is educated or not.
親父は今日中に帰るかも知れませんがしかとはわかりません
Father may come home in the course of the day, but I can't say for certain.
しかとわかっている
I know it for a certainty.
彼が米探だということがどうしてわかったか
How did you know him for a spy?
挙動でわかった
I knew it by his behaviour.
どうなるかわからん
There is no saying what may happen―Anything may happen.
彼はどうなったかわからん
I don't know―Nobody knows―God knows―what has become of him.
彼はどこへ行ったかわからん
I don't know where he has gone―Nobody knows where he has gone―He has gone God knows where.
どんな結果を生ずるかわかったものでない
I don't know―I can't say―There is no saying―It remains to be seen―what will come of it.
彼はせっぱつまったら何をするかわかったものじゃない
There is no saying what he may do at a pinch―He may do anything at a pinch.
彼はどうして生きておれるか僕にどうしてもわからぬ
How he manages to live, is more than I can tell―above my comprehension―incomprehensible to me―a mystery to me―beyond me.
彼はどうして暮らして行けるか僕にはどうしてもわからぬ
How he manages to live,passes my comprehension.
彼の心はとてもわからぬ
His mind is incomprehensible to me―a sealed book to me―He is an enigma―a riddle―a sphinx.
人間にわからないことがいくらもある
There are many things above human comprehension.
僕の言うことがどうしても先方へわからなかった
I could not make myself understood by him―make myself intelligible to him.
僕には違いがわからない
I can not see the difference―I fail to see the difference.
あの人はしゃれがわからない
He can not see a joke―enter into a joke.
僕には話の落ちがわからない
I do not see the point of the joke.
君には話の落ちがわかるまい
You can not catch the point―You miss the point.
お前達にわかって堪まるものか
I'm damned if you can see.
彼の気心がわからないから扱いにくい
I do not know how to deal with him, for I do not know his temper.
あれは気心のわからない人だ
He is an enigma―a riddle―a sphinx.
ようやく事の真相がわかりました
I now view the matter in its true light.
自分の行動が犯罪を構成しているこがわかりました
I now view my action in the light of a crime.
彼が失敗することは始めからわかっておった
I knew all along that he would fail―His failure was a foregone conclusion.
意味はよくわかる
The meaning is clear to me.
このキズは商売人でなければわからない
The flaw is only clear to the professional eye.
この道理はどんなばかにでもわかることだ
The truth is obvious to the dullest understanding.
字書を引いてみればその意味がわかる
A dictionary will tell you the meaning―make the meaning clear.
ちょっと考えてみばわかることだ
A moment's thought will make the matter clear.
考えれば考えるほどわからなくなる
The more I think, the less I understand.
この道理は説明をまたずしてわかる(自ら明らか)
The truth is self-evident.
(善い品だか悪い品だか)見ればわかる
The article speaks for itself.
どんなものだか見なけりゃわからぬ(想像もつかぬ)
You can form no idea of what it is like, unless you see it for yourself.
動物園の獅子を見たのでは野に居る時の堂々たる状態がわからぬ
From the lion in the Zoological Gardens, you can form no idea of his wild majesty when he roams freely over his native plains.
(見たことが無いから)どんなものだか少しもわからぬ
I have no idea of―have not the least idea of―have not the slightest idea of―have not the faintest idea of―what it is like.
話だけではわからないから現物を見たいものだ
I can form no idea from the description alone, so I should like to see the article for myself.
この絵を見ればその実況が多少わかる
The picture will give you some idea of―convey some idea of―the actual scene.
活動写真で見ると塹壕戦の実況がよくわかる
The kinema gives us a good idea of―conveys a good idea of―the actual scene of trench-fighting.
漠然とわかる
to form a vague idea of anything
戦争というものがボンヤリわかった
I have a vague idea of war.
説明を聞いてボンヤリわかった
The explanation has given me a vague idea.
彼の意を容易に察してわかった
I readily guessed his meaning.
彼の意をいろいろ察してもわからなかった
I vainly guessed at his meaning.
尻押しはたいがいわかっている
I have a shrewd guess as to who is at the bottom of the affair.
あれほど言い聞かしてもまだわからない
All my talk has been in vain.
よくはわからんがなんでもそんなことだ
I am not sure of it, but it is something like that.
君は音楽がわかるか
Have you an ear for music?
僕は音楽がわからぬ
I have no ear for music.

content: 2. (=判明する)to prove; to turn out; to be found out:(主格によってわかる)to show; to indicate; to bespeak; to testify to (a fact); to bear witness to (a fact); to account for (a fact); to throw light upon (a fact)

content.content: 評判が事実とわかった
The report proved true.
風説が虚説とわかった、事実無根とわかった
The rumour turned out false―proved to be unfounded.
この事実を見ても彼の無罪なことがわかる
The fact shows him to be innocent―testifies to his innocence―bears witness to his innocence.
人の顔を見れば心が判る
One's face indicates one's mind―“The face is the index of the mind.”
この行動を見ても彼の寛仁大度な性質がわかる
This action bespeaks his generous disposition.
彼は西洋人の家に居るのか、それで彼の英語のうまいことがわかった
Does he live with a foreigner? That accounts for his English.
それでわかった(道理で)
That accounts for it.
それで彼がぜいたくのできるわけがわかった
That accounts for his extravagance.
この話によって彼がどれほど世間を知らないかということがわかる
This story shows how little he knows the world.
この事実によって多少彼の人物がわかる
This fact throws some light upon his character.
彼に聞いたらこのことがわかるかも知れぬ
He may throw light upon the matter.
いまにわかる(時がたてば事実が判明する)
Time will show.
身元がわかる
to be identified
溺死者の身元がまだわからない
The drowned body is not yet identified.
良家の娘とわかった
She has been identified as the daughter of a respectable family.

content: 3. (=現れる、発見される、確められる)to show itself; to be found; to be discovered; to be ascertained; to become known; to come to light

content.content: 天才は幼い時からわかる
Genius will show itself―assert itself―at an early age.
惚れたのは素振りでわかる
Love shows itself―betrays itself―in one's look and manner.
この事実がどうしてわかったか
How did this fact become known?―come to light?
偶然わかった
It became known by chance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Chance brought it to light.
事実が容易にわかった
The fact was readily ascertained.
会計検査によって会計の不正なことがわかった
The audit has brought the dishonesty of the treasurer to light.
泥棒がわかった
The thief has been discovered.
彼が泥棒だということがやっとわかった
I now find him to have been the thief.
紛失した書類がとうとうわかりません
I have been unable to find the missing papers.
悪いことをするとわかる
An evil deed will be found out―“Murder will out.”
君はこの金を取っても誰にもわかりはせぬ
If you take the money, nobody will be the wiser.
事実がそろそろわかってきた
The truth is dawning upon my mind.
今頃はそろそろわかったろう
The truth must have dawned upon his mind by this.
雪で道がわからない
The snow has obliterated the path.
日数がたっているから跡がわかるまい
The traces must have been obliterated, as days have gone by.
あの婦人は年がわからない(曖昧な年だ)
She is of a non-committal age.

content: 4. (=区別する)to distinguish (one thing from another); to know (one thing from another); can tell (one thing from another)

content.content: 英国人と米国人はどこでわかるか
How do you know an Englishman from an American?―How can you tell an Englishman from an American?
言葉遣いでわかる
You can tell by the way they speak English.
食える茸と食えない茸はどこでわかるか
How do you know―How can you tell―a good mushroom from a bad one?
縦に裂いてみるとわかる
One can tell by the way they split, or do not split, from end to end.
匂いでもわかる
One can also tell by their smell.
牡と牝は大きさでわかるか
You can tell the male from the female by their size.

content: 5. (=事理を解する)to have sense; to be sensible

content.content: 彼はわけがわかっている、なかなか話がわかる
He has good sense―He is quite sensible―He knows what's what.
わけのわかった男だ
He is a sensible fellow―a man of sense.
わけのわからない男だ
He lacks sense.
君はもう少しわけがわかっているかと思った
I gave you credit for more sense.
わかったことを言う
to talk sense
わけのわからないことを言う
to talk nonsense―talk jargon―talk gibberish
そう言えば話がわかる
Now you are talking sense.
彼は道理のわかる人間だ
He will listen to reason―He is reasonable―amenable be reason―open to conviction.
お前は道理のわからない男だ
You will not listen to reason―You are unreasonable―impervious to reason.

content: 6. (=認める)to recognize; to know

content.content: 彼がその溺死体を見たら己が息子とわかった
He recognized his own son in the drowned body.
頸の黒子{ほくろ}で息子だということがわかった
He recognized his son by a mole on his neck.
君は道で逢ったらわからないほど変わった
I should not know you if I met you in the streets.
生みの母にもわかるまい
His own mother would not know him.
子どもの時分かれたのだから今逢ってもわかるまい
I shall perhaps not know him, for I have not seen him since he was a child.
暗くて自分の家がわからなかった
I did not recognize my own house in the dark.
あの声は確かにあなたとわかりました
I recognized the voice as yours.
彼はわからないほど変わっている
He is changed beyond recognition.
彼は誰だかわからないほどメチャメチャに殴られた
He was thrashed beyond recognition.

content: 7. (=鑑定する)to be judge of (swords); to be a connoisseur of (paintings, etc.)

content.content: 君は刀剣がわかるか
Are you a judge of swords?
あの人は書画がわかる
He is a connoisseur of paintings.
僕は骨董はわからぬ
I am no judge of curios.

content: 8. (=発表される)to be published; to be made known

content.content: 試験の成績はいつわかりますか
When shall we know the result of the examination?
当選者はわかったか
Are the names of the successful candidates published?―Is the result of the election known?

content: 9. (=味がわかる)to appreciate; to know

content.content: 君は英詩がわかるか
Can you appreciate English poetry?
君には貧乏の味がわかるか
You do not know what it is to be poor―You are a stranger to poverty.
貧乏の味も借金の味もわかっている
I know what it is to be poor and in debt―I am no stranger to the bitterness of poverty.

content: 10. (=消息がわかる)to be heard of

content.content: 出征軍人のことはどこへ行って聞けばわかりますか
Where are the men at the front to be heard of?
あの人の移動は学校へ行って聞けばわかる
He is to be heard of at the school.

content: 11. (=用がわかる)to understand (the business)

content.content: 君で用がわかるか
Can you attend to my business?
私は代理ですからご用がわかります
I can attend to your business in place of my principal.
私は小僧ですからご用はわかりません
I am only a shop-boy, and can give you no answer.
君は英語で用がわかるか
Can you make yourself understood in English?

content: 12. (=無いことがわかる)to notice the absence; to miss; to be missed

content.content: 彼が居ないことはその時はわからなかった
I did not notice his absence―I did not miss him―at the time.
宝石がこんなにたくさんあるから一つ二つ無くなったとてわかりはせぬ
There are so many gems that one or two would not be missed.
あんなに大勢居たから十人や二十人抜けたとてわかりはしなかったろう
There were so many of them that ten or twenty would not have been missed.

content:
わかれ〔分れ、岐れ、別れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=別れ)parting:(=る) to part

content.content: 左右に分かれる
to part right and left―go different ways
群集は左右に分かれて一行を通した
The crowd parted right and left to make way for the party.
二人は東西に分かれた
They parted and went different ways.

content: 2. (=分岐)a branch; an offshoot:(=る)(二つに分かれる)to branch off (into two); to fork; to bifurcate:(四方八方へ分かれる)to branch out; to diverge (from the centre); to radiate (in all directions):(本道から分かれる)to branch, diverge, depart (from the main road)

content.content: 力学は物理の分かれである
Dynamics is a branch of physics.
徳川は源氏の分かれだ
The Tokugawas are a branch of the Minamoto family.
彼の画風は土佐派の分かれである
His style of painting is a branch of the Tosa school―an offshoot from the Tosa school.
両校とも本校の分かれだ
Both schools are offshoots from ours.
この河は利根川の分かれだ
This river is a tributary of the Tone.
道路はここで二つに分かれる
At this point the road forks―bifurcates―branches off into two.
大宮で線路が二つに分かれる
The line branches off into two at Omiya.
この線は宇都宮で本線から分かれる
This line branches from the main line at Utsunomiya.
この道は本道から分かれた道だ
This road branches from the main road―branches off from the main road.
鉄道が都から四方八方へ分かれている
The railways branch out from the capital―radiate from the capital―diverge from the capital―in all directions.

content: 3. (=分離)separation; division; split:(=る) to separate; to split; to be divided

content.content: 新教が旧教から分かれた
The Protestant Church separated from the Roman Catholic Church.
米国が英国から分かれた
American separated from England.
彼は女と別れた
He has separated from her.
彼は女と表面はきれいに別れた
He is outwardly nothing to her now.
政党がいくつもの党派に分かれた
The party split into factions.
攻撃軍は二隊に分かれた
The attacking force was divided into two parties.
日本画は幾派にも分かれている
Japanese painting is divided into several schools.
委員は意見が分かれている
The committee is divided in opinion.
この問題について説が分かれている
Opinion is divided on this subject―There is a split on the question.
源平に分かれる
to divide into sides―take sides
会員は源平に分かれて討論する
The members take sides in the debate.

content: 4. (=違い)difference:(=る) to differ (from each other); to depart (from the old)

content.content: これ東洋人と西洋人の心理の分かるるところ
This is the point where the mentality of the East differs from that of the West.
ここが即ち旧式と新式の分かるるところである
This is where the new style departs from the old.

content:
わかれ〔分れ、岐れ、別れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=別れ)parting:(=る) to part

content.content: 左右に分かれる
to part right and left―go different ways
群集は左右に分かれて一行を通した
The crowd parted right and left to make way for the party.
二人は東西に分かれた
They parted and went different ways.

content: 2. (=分岐)a branch; an offshoot:(=る)(二つに分かれる)to branch off (into two); to fork; to bifurcate:(四方八方へ分かれる)to branch out; to diverge (from the centre); to radiate (in all directions):(本道から分かれる)to branch, diverge, depart (from the main road)

content.content: 力学は物理の分かれである
Dynamics is a branch of physics.
徳川は源氏の分かれだ
The Tokugawas are a branch of the Minamoto family.
彼の画風は土佐派の分かれである
His style of painting is a branch of the Tosa school―an offshoot from the Tosa school.
両校とも本校の分かれだ
Both schools are offshoots from ours.
この河は利根川の分かれだ
This river is a tributary of the Tone.
道路はここで二つに分かれる
At this point the road forks―bifurcates―branches off into two.
大宮で線路が二つに分かれる
The line branches off into two at Omiya.
この線は宇都宮で本線から分かれる
This line branches from the main line at Utsunomiya.
この道は本道から分かれた道だ
This road branches from the main road―branches off from the main road.
鉄道が都から四方八方へ分かれている
The railways branch out from the capital―radiate from the capital―diverge from the capital―in all directions.

content: 3. (=分離)separation; division; split:(=る) to separate; to split; to be divided

content.content: 新教が旧教から分かれた
The Protestant Church separated from the Roman Catholic Church.
米国が英国から分かれた
American separated from England.
彼は女と別れた
He has separated from her.
彼は女と表面はきれいに別れた
He is outwardly nothing to her now.
政党がいくつもの党派に分かれた

攻撃軍は二隊に分かれた

日本画は幾派にも分かれている

委員は意見が分かれている

この問題について説が分かれている
Opinion is divided on this subject―There is a split on the question.
源平に分かれる
to divide into sides―take sides
会員は源平に分かれて討論する
The members take sides in the debate.

content.content: これ東洋人と西洋人の心理の分かるるところ
