content:
わかれ〔別れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=別離)parting:(=る) to part (from a companion); to part company (with a consort)

content.content: 彼とは今別れて来たばかりだ
I have only just parted from him.
彼と別れてから三年になる
It is three years since I saw him last.
僚艦が暴風に逢って別れた
The consorts parted company in a gale.
仲好く別れる、機嫌好く別れる
to part friends―part in amity
機嫌直して別れようじゃないか
Let us part in amity!
二人はけんかして別れた(けんか別れをした)
They parted in anger.
互いに名残りを惜しんで別れた
We parted on the best of terms―parted the best of friends―parted with mutual regret―parted with many expressions of good-will and esteem.
別れを惜しんだ
We were sorry to part unwilling to part―loath to part―reluctant to part.
泣きの涙で別れた
We parted in tears.
女は別れる時(別れに臨んで)泣いた
She cried at parting.
別れが辛い
It is hard to part.
別れが辛かった
I found it hard to part―I felt a great tug at parting―Parting was a tug.
逢って嬉しや
What a joy it is to meet!
別れの辛さ
How hard it is to part!
逢って別れが
Would that we could ever meet,
無けりゃ好い
Never, never to part!
逢うは別れの始め
Meeting is, in a manner, the beginning of parting―We meet, only to part.
逢うて別れは浮世の習い
Those who meet, must part―“The best of friends must part.”
別れてもまた逢う
We part to meet again.
仲間と別れるに忍びなかった
I could not tear myself from my companion.
仲間と急に別れて来た
I broke away from my companion.
これが一生の別れとなるかも知れぬ
This may prove a parting for life.
永の別れとなるかも知れぬ
This may prove aparting for ever―a parting for good.
あれがこの世の別れとなろうとは夢にも思わなんだ
I little dreamed that I had seen him for the last time―I little thought that I should see him no more.
別れを告げる
to bid one farewell―bid one adieu―say good-bye―take leave of one's friends
彼は故郷に永の別れを告げた
He bade his home adieu, never to return.
Byron は本国に永の別れを告げた
Byron left his native land, never to return.
お別れの接吻をする
to give one a parting kiss―kiss one good-bye
別れの盃をする
to exchange a parting cup―exchange a stirrup-cup

content: 3. (=別居)separation:(=る) to separate (from one's husband)

content.content: 夫婦は別れている
The couple live apart.
夫婦は話し合いで別れた
Man and wife separated by common consent.

content: 4. (=解散)breaking up:(=る) to break up

content.content: 学校は休暇になって皆別れる
The school breaks up for the holidays.
別れー(号令)
Dismiss!

content:
わかれでる〔分れ出る、岐れ出る〕
〈自動〉To branch out (from the main office); to diverge (from the centre); to radiate (from a point)

content.content: 車輪の幅{や}轂{こしき}から四方八方に分かれ出る
The spokes of a wheel radiate from the hub in all directions.
これが京都の本店から分かれ出た店だ
This is a branch of the main office in Kyoto.

content:
わかれでる〔分れ出る、岐れ出る〕
〈自動〉To branch out (from the main office); to diverge (from the centre); to radiate (from a point)

content.content: 車輪の幅{や}轂{こしき}から四方八方に分かれ出る
The spokes of a wheel radiate from the hub in all directions.
これが京都の本店から分かれ出た店だ
This is a branch of the main office in Kyoto.

わかれみち〔分れ路〕
〈名〉(両方を指して言えば)a forked road; a bifurcate road;(片々を指して言えば)a branch-road

わかれめ〔分かれ目〕
〈名〉A branching point:(鉄道なら)a junction:(道なら)a parting of the ways

content:
わかれわかれに〔分れ分れに〕
〈副〉Apart; separately; singly; each by himself:(=なる) to disperse; to scatter; to break up

content.content: 夫婦が分かれ分かれになっている
Man and wife live apart.
兄弟が分かれ分かれに住んでいる
The brothers live apart―separately―each by himself.
いっしょに行くと怪しまれるから分かれ分かれに行こう
In order to disarm suspicion, let us go singly―each by himself.
一家が分かれ分かれになる
A family breaks up―A home is torn up.

content:
わかわかしい〔若々しい〕
〈形〉Youthful; fresh

content.content: あの女は若々しい顔をしている
She has a fresh young face.

わかん〔和姦〕
〈名〉Fornication:(=する) to fornicate (with a woman)

content:
わかん〔和漢〕
〈形〉Japanese and Chinese

content.content: 彼は和漢の学に通じている
He is versed in Japanese and Chinese literature.

content:
わかんよう〔和漢洋〕
〈形〉Japanese, Chinese, and Western

content.content: 彼は和漢洋の学に通じている
He is versed in Japanese, Chinese, and Western lore.

content:
わき〔和気〕
〈名〉Peace; harmony; concord

content.content: 和気靄々{あいあい}
to be harmonious
和気靄然たり
Harmony reigns.
和気靄々たる一家の団欒は人生無上の幸福である
A harmonious household is the greatest happiness on earth.
和気靄々の裡に一同散会した
The meeting broke up in perfect amity―We parted on the best of terms.

content:
わき〔脇〕
〈名〉
1. (=そば、横の方)side:(=に) by the side of, beside, by (something); near by, close by, hard by (some place):(=へ) to one side; aside

content.content: 脇へ寄れ
Draw to one side!―Draw aside!
子どもがお母さんの脇に坐っている
The child is siting by its mother.
お母さんの脇に立っている
She is standing beside her mother.
番小屋は門の脇にある
The lodge stands by the gate.
戸の脇に自転車がある
There is a bicycle by the door.
学校のじき脇に下宿しました
I have taken up my quarters near by the school―close by the school―hard by the school.
その子を脇へ呼んで優しい言葉をかけてやった
I called the child to my side, and spoke kindly to her.
脇へ引寄せる
to draw anything to one's side
脇へ押してやる
to push anything aside
脇を向く
to look aside
(芝居の)脇白{わきぜりふ}
an aside

content: 2. (=ほか、よそ)another place:(=の) other:(=へ) away

content.content: 脇を見る
to look away
本を見ずに脇を見る
to look off one's book
話を脇へそらす
to divert the talk from one subject to another―change the subject
彼は話を一笑に付して脇へそらした
He changed the subject with a laugh.
話が脇へ逸れました
I have digressed from the subject―wandered from the point.
これから脇へまわらなければならない
I have another place to go to.
脇ではもっと安く売っている
They sell it cheaper elsewhere.
それでは脇でお買いなさい
Then please go somewhere else.
流れを脇へ転ずる
to divert the stream into a new channel

content: 3. (=脇の下)the armpit:(=に) under the arm

content.content: 本を脇にはさむ
to hold a book under one's arm
本を脇にはさんで出て来た
He came out with a book under his arm.

content: 4. (=芝居の脇役)a supporting part

content.content: 脇をする、脇を勤める
to support an actor―(転用すれば)―play a subordinate part―play second fiddle

content:
わぎ〔和議〕
〈名〉Peace conference

content.content: 和議を申し込む
to make overtures of peace―hold out the olive-branch
和議を調える
to make peace with―conclude peace with―the enemy

content:
わきおこる〔涌き起る〕
〈自動〉To rise

content.content: 万歳の声が涌き起こった
Cheers arose from the crowd.

わきが〔脇香〕
〈名〉The smell of the armpit; axillary odour

content:
わきかえる〔涌き返る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=煮え立つ)to boil up; to boil over
2. (=騒ぎ立つ)to seethe; to ferment; to be in a ferment

content.content: 全国涌き返るような騒ぎ
The whole country was in a ferment.
議場は涌き返るような騒ぎ
The House was in an uproar.
人民は不平で涌き返るよう
The people were seething with discontent.

わきげ〔脇毛〕
〈名〉The hair of the armpit; axillary hair

わきざし〔脇差〕
〈名〉A short sword

content:
わきし〔脇師〕
〈名〉(=芝居の脇師)A supporting actor

content.content: 脇師を勤める
to support an actor

わきぜりふ〔脇白〕
〈名〉An aside

わきたつ〔涌き立つ〕
〈自動〉To boil up

content:
わきでる〔涌き出る〕
〈自動〉To gush out, gush forth; to well up, well out, well forth

content.content: 水が盛んに涌き出る
Water gushes forth―wells forth.
泡立って涌き出る
Water bubbles up.

content:
わきのした〔腋下〕
〈名〉The armpit:(=に) under the arm

content.content: 腋の下に本を抱えている
He has a book under his arm.
腋の下に本を抱えて出て来た
He came out with a book under his arm.
腋の下をくすぐる
to tickle one under the arm
腋の下に冷汗をかいた
I had a cold sweat under my arms.

content:
わきばら〔脇腹〕
〈名〉
1. (=横腹)the side (of the chest); the flank

content.content: 凶漢が短刀をもって彼の脇腹を突いた
The ruffian stabbed him in the side.
脇腹がつる
I have a stitch in the side―a twinge in the side.
(人の注意を引くために)脇腹をえぐる
to dig one in the ribs―poke one in the ribs―nudge one―jog one

content: 2. (=妾腹)a child by a concubine

わきまえ〔弁え〕
〈名〉Distinction; discrimination; discernment; discretion; understanding; knowledge:(=る) to distinguish; to discriminate; to discern; to understand; to know

content.content: 彼は弁えの有る男だ、事理を弁えている
He has good sense―He is sensible―He is a man of sense.
弁えが無い、事理を弁えぬ
He lacks sense―He is devoid of sense.
お前はこんなことの弁えがつく年だ
You are of an age to understand such things.
黒白を弁える
to distinguish between right and wrong
その道を弁えている
He is versed in the art.
君臣の分を弁えている
I know my place as servant―know my station as subject.
前後の弁えも無く知っていることをしゃべってしまった
I blabbed all I know without reflecting on the consequences.

content:
わきみ〔脇見〕
〈名〉Looking aside:(=する) to look aside; to look away; to look off

content.content: 本を見ずに脇見する
to look off one's book
(先生が生徒に向かって)誰でも脇見をしている者があったら知らして下さい
If any one of you sees another boy looking off his book, let him come and tell me.
君は脇見をして歩くから人に突き当たるのだ
You keep looking aside, and that's why you run against people.

content:
わきみち〔脇路〕
〈名〉A by-path

content.content: 本道から脇路へ入る
to go off the road
その村は少し脇路へ入った所だ
The village is a little way off the road.
脇路へそれる
to go astray―(話なら)―digress from the subject
若いうちは脇路へそれやすい
Young people are apt to go astray.
話が脇路へそれました
I have digressed from the subject―wandered from the point.
脇路へそれないで
Do not wander from the point!―Keep to the point!
議論が脇路へそれた
This is a side-issue―an off issue.

content:
わきめ〔脇目〕
〈名〉
1. (=脇見)looking aside

content.content: 脇目も振らぬ
He never looks to right or left.
脇目も振らずに一直線に進んだ
He held on his course without looking to right or left.
彼は脇目も振らずに勉強している
He is intent on his studies.
脇目を振らずに金儲けに夢中になっている
He is intent on money-making.

content: 2. (=端の目)other's eyes

content.content: 人の仕事は脇目からはつまらなく見えるものだ
One's pursuits will seem insignificant in other eyes.
病人は脇目で見るほど苦しくはないのだ
The invalid himself suffers less than the others.

content:
わきやく〔脇役〕
〈名〉(=芝居の脇役)A supporting part

content.content: 脇役をする、脇役を勤める
to support an actor―(転用すれば)―play a subordinate part―play second fiddle

わきょう〔和協〕
〈名〉Harmonious cooperation:(=する) to cooperate in harmony

content:
わきょく〔和局〕
〈名〉Peace; amicable settlement

content.content: 和局を結ぶ
to make peace with the enemy―come to an amicable settlement

わきよる〔脇寄る〕
〈自動〉To draw aside; to draw to one side

content:
わぎり〔輪切り〕
〈名〉A round (of radish, etc.)

content.content: 大根などを輪切りにする
to cut a radish into rounds
輪切り大根
rounds of radishes

content:
わく〔沸く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=煮え立つ)to boil; to grow hot

content.content: 湯が沸いた
The water is boiling.
風呂が沸いた
The bath is hot―The bath is ready.
この風呂は沸きやすい
The bath is soon hot.
満堂鼎の沸くが如し
The whole house was in an uproar.
血が沸く
My blood boils.
彼の言うことを聞くと血が沸く
His words make my blood boil.
血の沸くような冒険談
thrilling tales of adventures
これを思えば血沸き肉踊る
My blood tingles at the thought.

content:
2. (=醗酵する)to ferment
3. (=金属が鎔解する)to melt; to fuse

わく〔涌く、湧く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=涌き出る)to gush out, gust forth; to well up, well out, well forth; to come out; to flow; to issue

content.content: ここを掘ると水が涌く
If you dig here, water will come out.
水が盛んに涌く
Water gushes forth―wells forth.
智慧が涌いた
An idea has occurred to my mind―An idea has come into my head.
喝采涌くが如し
There is enthusiastic applause.
愛国の至情勃然{ぼつぜん}として涌くを覚ゆ
I feel the patriot rise within me.
天から降ったか地から涌いたか
A vision! an apparition!
天から降ったか地から涌いたか艶麗な婦人が眼前に現れた
A woman of ravishing beauty appeared before me like a vision―like an apparition.

content: 2. (=生ずる)to breed

content.content: 蛆が湧く
Worms breed.
魚に蛆が湧いた
Worms have bred in the fish―The fish has bred maggots.
たまり水に孑孑{ぼうふら}が湧く
Mosquito-larvae breed in stagnant water―Stagnant water breeds mosquito-larvae.
身体を不潔にしておくと虱{しらみ}が湧く
Lice will breed on an unclean person―An unclean person will breed vermin.
稲に虫が湧いた
The rice-plants are suffering from insect-pest.
米に虫が湧いた
Weevils are eating up the rice.

content:
わく〔涌く、湧く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=涌き出る)to gush out, gust forth; to well up, well out, well forth; to come out; to flow; to issue

content.content: ここを掘ると水が涌く
If you dig here, water will come out.
水が盛んに涌く
Water gushes forth―wells forth.
智慧が涌いた
An idea has occurred to my mind―An idea has come into my head.
喝采涌くが如し
There is enthusiastic applause.
愛国の至情勃然{ぼつぜん}として涌くを覚ゆ
I feel the patriot rise within me.
天から降ったか地から涌いたか
A vision! an apparition!
天から降ったか地から涌いたか艶麗な婦人が眼前に現れた
A woman of ravishing beauty appeared before me like a vision―like an apparition.

content: 2. (=生ずる)to breed

content.content: 蛆が湧く
Worms breed.
魚に蛆が湧いた
Worms have bred in the fish―The fish has bred maggots.
たまり水に孑孑{ぼうふら}が湧く
Mosquito-larvae breed in stagnant water―Stagnant water breeds mosquito-larvae.
身体を不潔にしておくと虱{しらみ}が湧く
Lice will breed on an unclean person―An unclean person will breed vermin.
稲に虫が湧いた
The rice-plants are suffering from insect-pest.
米に虫が湧いた
Weevils are eating up the rice.

content:
わく〔枠〕
〈名〉
1. (=額縁)a frame

content.content: 絵を枠に入れる
to put a picture in a frame―frame a picture
刺繍の枠
an embroidery-frame―a tambour―a tambouret

content: 2. (=糸巻き)a reel; a spool

わくせい〔惑星〕
〈名〉A planet:(=の) planetary

content.content: 惑星は太陽を中心に運行する
The planets revolve round the sun.
惑星儀
a planetarium

content:
わくでき〔惑溺〕
〈名〉
1. (=耽溺)addiction; infatuation:(=する) to addict oneself to be addicted to (pleasure); to be infatuated with (a woman)

content.content: 彼は酒色に惑溺している
He is addicted to sensual pleasures―given over to vices.
女の惑溺している
He is infatuated with a woman―taken with a girl―gone on a girl.
一女優の色香に惑溺している
He is smitten with the charms of an actress.

content: 2. (=妄惑)delusion; obsession:(=する) to be deluded; to be obsessed

content.content: 迷信に惑溺している
He is obsessed by superstition.

わくらん〔惑乱〕
〈名〉Delusion; temptation; perplexity:(=する)(他動詞に用いれば)to delude; to tempt; to perplex:(自動詞に用いれば)to be deluded; to be tempted; to be perplexed

content:
わけ〔分け〕
〈名〉A draw; a drawn game

content.content: 角力が分けになった
The match ended in a draw.

content:
わけ〔訳〕
〈名〉
1. (=理由)reason; cause; ground

content.content: それはどういうわけか
What is the reason?―How is that?―How do you account for that?
どういうわけで君はいつも遅刻するか
How is it―How comes it―How happens it―that you are always late for school?
どういうわけで君はあの人を知っているか
How comes it that you know him?―How came you to know him?
どういうわけで君は彼と仲が悪くなったのか
How comes it that you are on bad terms with him?―How came you to be on bad terms with him?
どういうわけで君は辞職するのか
Why do you wish to resign?―For what reason do you wish to resign?―What is your season for wishing to resign?―On what grounds do you wish to resign?―How is it that you wish to resign?
何か不平でもあるというわけなのか
Is it that you are dissatisfied with anything?
不平が有るというわけではないが任に堪えないからです
Not that I have anything to complain of, but that―but because―I am unequal to the task.
そういうわけで辞職するのです
I must resign for that reason―That is my reason for resigning―That is the reason why I must resign―That is why I must resign―Therefore I must resign.
あの人はいつも払いが後れるのはどういうわけかしら
I wonder what can be the reason for his being always behindhand with his payment―I wonder how it is that he is always behindhand with his payment.
あの人は勉強をすることはするが、どういうわけか成功しない
He does work hard, but somehow he does not succeed―I know not how it is, but he does not succeed.
僕は全力を尽しているけれどもどういうわけか彼は満足してくれない
I am doing my best, but somehow I can not satisfy him―I know not how it is, but I can not satisfy him.
僕はなにも辞職するわけが無い
Why should I resign?―There is no reason why I should resign.
なにも自分の金を使って悪いというわけはあるまい
Why should I not spend my own money?―I see no reason why I should not spend my own money.
彼がなにも立腹するわけはあるまい
Why should he be offended?―I can see no reason why he should take offence.
彼はどういうわけで立腹したかわけがわからぬ
I am at a loss to comprehend the reason why he should be offended.
そんなに金の要るわけが無い
There is no reason why he should need so much money―He can not need so much money―It is impossible that he can need so much money.
彼は金が返せないわけが無い
There is no reason why he should be unable to pay the money―He can not be unable to pay the money―He must be able to pay the money.
これには何か深いわけのあることだろう
There must be some reason for this.
そりゃおかしいね、そのわけは(?)
That's odd. What is the reason?―Explain yourself!
わけを聞く
to inquire the reason
ぜひそのわけが聞きたい
I must positively know your reason―I insist on knowing your reason.
そのわけ聞かなきゃ帰されぬ
You can not go unless you tell me your reason.
わけを糺す
to inquire into the reason
わけを言う
to state one's reason―explain one's reason
わけを言ったら承知するだろう
If I explain my reason, perhaps he will consent.
彼に聞いたらわけがわかるだろう
He will tell you why.
わけがわかった
I know the reason now.
それでわけがわかった(道理で)
That accounts for it.
それで彼の英語のうまいわけがわかった(道理で英語がうまいと思った)
That accounts for his English.
この人はなんのわけも無く僕を打ちました
He has struck me without cause―without provocation.

content: 2. (=道理)reason

content.content: (人を相手に)わけを説く
to reason with one
わけを説いて心得違いを諭した
I reasoned with him on his error.
彼女にわけを説いて承知さした
I reasoned her into compliance.
わけを説いて心配させないようにした
I reasoned her out of her fears.
彼はわけを説くとよくわかる(聞き分けがある、理に服す)
He will listen to reason―He is quite reasonable―amenable to reason―open to conviction.
彼女はわけを説いてもわからない(聞き分けが無い、理に服さぬ)
She will not listen to reason―She is unreasonable―impervious to reason.
彼はわけがわかっている
He has good sense―He is quite sensible―He knows what's what.
わけのわかった男だ
He is a sensible fellow―a man of sense.
わけのわからない男だ
He lacks sense―He is devoid of sense.
ちっともわけのわからない奴だ
He is an idiot.
君はもう少しわけがわかっているかと思った
I gave you credit for more sense.
なるほど君はそう思うわけだ(そう思うのはもっともだ)
You have good reason to think so―You may well think so―It is quite natural that you should think so.
なるほど彼は威張るわけだ
He has good reason to be proud―He may well be proud―It is quite natural that he should be proud.
なるほど彼は成功するわけだ
It is quite natural that he should succeed―It is no wonder that he should succeed―He ought to succeed.
ずいぶん降ったから天気になっても好いわけだ
The weather ought to be fine after this long rain.

content: 3. (=意味)meaning; sense

content.content: ここはどういうわけですか
What is the meaning of this passage?
どうぞここのわけを教えて下さい
Please explain the meaning of the passage?
この電報は少しもわけがわからない

I can't make out the meaning of this telegram―I can make no sense of this telegram―I can make nothing of this telegram―I do not know what to make of this telegram―I can not make head or tail of this telegram.
これはなんのことだかわけがわからぬ
It is quite unintelligible―incomprehensible―past my comprehension.
彼の言うことはさっぱりわけがわからぬ
I can make nothing of―don't know what to make of―can't make head or tail of―what he says―What he says is unintelligible to me―Greek to me―without rhyme or reason.
彼はわけのわからないことばかり言っている
He talks nonsense―talks jargon―talks gibberish.
あの人のわけのわからない話は聞きあきた
I am tired of his nonsensical talk―his senseless talk.

content: 4. (=事情)the circumstances; the case; the matter

content.content: そういうわけさ
Such is the case―The case stands thus―The matter stands thus.
まあそんなわけさ
That is the state of the case―So the matter stands.
そういうわけだからご返済致しかねます
Such being the case, I can not pay you―I can not pay you under the circumstances.
そういうわけなら待って上げてもよろしい
If that is the case,―If so,―I can wait.
こういうわけさ(一通り聞いて下さい)
This is how it happened―It was this way.
そういうわけではない
Such is not the case―It is no such matter.
どうしてこんなわけになったのか
How did things come to this?
そうなるとわけが違う
That alters the case.
わけを話す
to state one's case―tell one's story
わけを話して待って貰った
I stated my case, and asked him to wait.
わけを話して一夜の宿を乞うた
I told my story, and asked for a night's lodging.

content: 5. (=密通)connection; improper connection

content.content: 彼女は隣りの主人とわけがあったそうだ
She was said to have an improper connection with her next-door neighbour.

content:
6. 
〈助動詞〉Ought; must; can not

content.content: 彼はだいぶ儲けたから金が有るわけだ
He has made much money, so he ought to be rich.
三日も降ったからもう晴れても好いわけだ
It has been raining for three days, so it ought to clear up by this.
英語を三年もやったら話せるわけだ
If he has been studying English for three years, he must be able to speak it.
英語を始めたばかりだから話せるわけが無い
He has only just begun English, so he can not be able to speak it.
彼はまだ着くわけが無い
He can not have arrived yet.
待つわけにはいきません
I can not wait―It is impossible for me to wait.
笑わないわけにはいかない(笑わざるを得ぬ)
I can not but laugh―I can not help laughing.

content:
7. 
〈その他〉

content.content: それとこれとはわけが違う
That is one thing, this is another thing.
実行となるとわけが違う
If you come to practise it, that's another thing―that's another pair of shoes.
英語を使うと教えるとはわけが違う
To speak English is one thing; to teach it is quite another thing.
彼は例の三文文士とはわけが違う
He is none of your penny-a-liners.
これは本物だ、例の怪しいダイヤとはわけが違う
This is a genuine article. It is none of your flashy diamonds.
わけの無い
easy―simple
これはわけの無いことだ
This is quite easy―quite simple.
こんなわけの無いことは無い
Nothing is easier―Nothing can be simpler.
彼は師匠の上手に出たようなわけさ
He has, as it were, outdone his master.
まあ当分居候をしているようなわけさ
I am, as it were, a dependant for the time being.
(切符を)無くしたというわけではない、人に預けて忘れて来たのだ
I did not exactly lose it. I gave it to some one to hold, and forgot all about it.
彼は吝嗇というわけではない(少し違う)
He is not exactly a miser.
彼は決して吝嗇というわけではない(たいそう違う)
He is by no means a miser.
敵は決して勇気が無いというわけではない
The enemy are by no means wanting in valour.
いや決してそういうわけではない
No such thing!―Nothing of the kind!

content:
わけあい〔訳合い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: わけ〔訳〕

content:
わけいる〔分け入る〕
〈他動〉To make one's way into (a place)

content.content: 群衆に分け入る
to push one's way into a crowd
処女林に分け入る
to cut one's way into a virgin forest
学びの道に分け入る
to enter upon one's studies

content:
わけがら〔訳柄〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: わけ〔訳〕

わけぎ〔分葱〕
〈名〉The chive; the shallot

content:
わけて〔分けて〕
〈副〉
1. (=別に)separately; apart

content.content: 雄と雌と分けておけ
Keep male and female apart―Keep the male apart from the female.
この金を分けて別にしておこう
I will set this money apart.
子どもの教育費を分けておく
A fund is set apart for the education of the children.
君のために仕事を分けておいた
I have set apart―reserved―a task for you.

content: 2. (=殊に)Particularly; especially; in especial

content.content: 分けてこの点にご注意を願います
I wish to call your especial attention to this point.
分けて語学の研究をお勧め申す
I would advise you in especial to cultivate the languages.
始めは分けて困難だ
The beginning is particularly difficult.
彼女の器量は分けて引き立つ
Her beauty stands out conspicuously.

content: 3. (=就中{なかんずく})above all things; before everything; of all things; most of all:(打ち消しに伴えば)least of all

content.content: 学生には分けて学問が大事だ
A student should, above all, attend to his studies.
実業家には時間を守ることが分けて必要だ
A business-man must, before everything, be punctual.
芝居は分けて面白い
I enjoy a play, of all things.
僕はすべて運動は好きだが分けて銃猟が好きだ
I am fond of all sports, but I love shooting most of all―best of all.
粗暴な振舞をするな、分けて婦人に対しては
Don't be rude to anybody, least of all, to ladies!

content: 4. (=だからいっそう)the more (because); the rather (that)

content.content: 不具な子は分けて可愛い
A deformed child is all the dearer to its parents.
彼は病身だから分けて可愛い
He is the dearer to me because he is sickly.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉Through

content.content: 人込みを分けて通る
to push one's way through a crowd
森を分けて進む
to advance through a wood
雪を分けて行軍する
to march through the snow
水雷は水を分けて走る
A torpedo rushes through the water.
飛行機は空気を分けて走る
An aeroplane rushes through the air.

わけどり〔分け取り〕
〈名〉Sharing:(=する) to share (anything between two or among many)

content:
わけへだて〔分け隔て〕
〈名〉Discrimination; distinction:(=する) to discriminate (between tow―in favour of one―against the other); to make distinctions (between two); to make fish of one and flesh of the other

content.content: 僕は人を分け隔てをせぬ
I do not discriminate between people―make distinctions between people―make fish of one and flesh of the other.
分け隔て無く人を扱う
I treat people without distinction.
西洋人を優先し日本人を冷遇するような分け隔てをしてはいけない
You must not discriminate in favour of foreigners and against Japanese.
米国では東洋人を分け隔てする
The Americans discriminate against the Orientals.

content:
わけまえ〔分け前〕
〈名〉A share; a portion; a quota

content.content: 銘々分け前を受ける
Each comes in for a share.
銘々に分け前を与えよ
Let each come in for a share!―Let each have his share!
僕も利益の分け前を貰う
I share in the profits.
過分の分け前を取る
to take the lion's share
銘々に分け前を割り当てる
to allot a share to each―assign a portion to each
誰の分け前に当たる
to fall to one's share
財産を分配した時この家が僕の分け前に当たった
When the property was divided, this house fell to my share.

content:
わけめ〔分け目〕
〈名〉A crisis; a critical moment; a decisive moment; a fateful moment

content.content: 天下分け目の合戦
a battle big with fate―a fateful battle―a decisive battle
病人の生死分け目は今だ
Now is a critical moment for the invalid.
今日が事業の成功失敗の分け目だ
This is a critical day for the enterprise―This day decides the success or failure of our enterprise.
最後の五分間が勝利と敗北の分け目だ
The last five minutes decide the day.

content:
わける〔分ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=分割する)to divide (anything into so many parts); to separate (one thing from another); to part; to partition; to portion; to split

content.content: 二つに分ける、三つに分ける
to divide anything into two parts―into three parts
金を二つに分ける
to split a sum
髪を分ける
to part one's hair
国を分ける
to partition a country―divide up a country
雄と雌を分ける
to separate the male from the female
雄と雌を分けておけ
Keep male and female apart―Keep the male apart from the female.
この金を分けて別にしておこう
I will set this money apart.
子どもの教育費を分けておく
A fund is set apart for the education of the children.
君のために仕事を分けておいた
I have set apart―reserved―a task for you.
手を分けて捜す
to form search-parties

content: 2. (=分配する)to distribute, divide (anything between tow or among many)

content.content: 財産を子どもに分ける
to divide one's property among one's children―settle a fortune on a child
彼は二人(三人)の子どもに財産を分けてくれた
He divided his property between his two children―among his tree children.
利益を分ける
to divide the profits (among the members)
儲かったらお前にも分けてやる
You shall share in the profits.
獲物を分ける
to divide the spoils
彼は獲物があると子分に分ける
He distributes the booty among his followers.
(番頭などに)暖簾を分けてやる
to set one up in business
カルタを分ける
to deal cards

content: 3. (=分け与える)to share, divide (anything with another); to spare (one anything)

content.content: この金を君と分けて使おう
I will share this money with you―divide this money with you.
彼は何でも惜しまず人と分ける
He will share his last dollar with a friend―share his last crust with a friend.
この本を一部分けてくれんか
Will you spare me a copy?

content: 4. (=引き分ける)to part (combatants)

content.content: けんかを分ける
to part the combatants―get between the combatants―pull the combatants apart―draw the combatants apart

content: 5. (=選り分ける)to sort (goods); to classify (objects)

content.content: 品物を分ける
to sort the articles
物を部門に分ける
to classify things

content: 6. (=区別する)to distinguish (between two things)

content.content: 正邪を分ける
to distinguish between right and wrong

content: 7. (=共にする)to share (one's fortunes)

content.content: 血を分けた仲だ
We are of the same blood―related by blood―consanguineous.

content:
8. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 人込みを分けて通る
to push one's way through a crowd
森を分けて進む
to advance through a wood
雪を分けて行軍する
to march through the snow
事を分ける
to reason
事を分けてのお諭し
a reasoned admonition

content:
わげん〔和絃〕
〈名〉［音楽］Concord

content.content: 不協和絃
discord

わこう〔和寇〕
〈名〉Japanese pirates (who invaded the coasts of Korea and China)

content:
わごう〔和合〕
〈名〉Harmony; concord; union; unity; unison:(=する) to be in harmony, be in concord, be in union, be in unity, be in unison

content.content: 一致和合して暮らす
to live in harmony―live in concord―live together in union―live together in unity
一家和合する
A family lives in harmony―A family lives in concord.
一家和合せぬ
The family is in discord―Discord prevails in the family.

わこうど〔若人〕
〈名〉A young man; a youth

わこんかんさい〔和魂漢才〕
〈名〉Japanese spirit and Chinese wisdom

content:
わざ〔業〕
〈名〉
1. (=仕業)(whose) work; (whose) doing

content.content: これはいったい誰の業だろう
Whose doing can it be?
彼の業に違いない
It must be his doing.
真人間の業とは思われない
It can not be the doing of a man in his senses.
悪魔の業だ
It is the work of the devil.
彼の助かったのは人間業とは思われない
His escape can not be the work of man―His escape is nothing short of a miracle.
確かに神業だ
It is the work of God―It is a miracle.

content: 2. (=芸)art

content.content: 業に長ずる
to excel in one's art
離れ業
a feat―(米国にては)―a stunt

content: 3. (=柔術の手)a trick; a chip

content.content: 業をかける
to use a trick
足業
a leg-trick―a leg-chip

content:
わざと〔態と〕
〈副〉Purposely; on purpose; of set purpose; designedly; by design; intentionally; deliberately; with deliberation; knowingly; wittingly

content.content: これはわざとしたのか、ただしは偶然か
Was it done by design or by chance?
わざとしたこととほか思われない
It must have been an intentional act―purposely done―done on purpose―done of set purpose.
彼は僕を困らせようと思ってわざとあんなことをするのだ
He does such things on purpose to annoy me.
貴様は俺にわざと突き当たったのだろう
You ran against me intentionally,―deliberately,―I suppose?
戸がわざと開けてある
The door is knowingly kept open.
わざと見ない人は真の盲よりも困る
He who will not see is worse than he who can not see.

content:
わざとらしい〔態とらしい〕
〈形〉Studied; forced; affected; unnatural

content.content: 主人はわざとらしくていねいに一行を迎えた
The master of the house received the party with a studied courtesy.
あの人はわざとらしいものの言いようをする
He has an affected way of speaking.
あの人が演説をする時に泣くのはわざとらしい
He has an unnatural way of crying on the platform.
わざとらしく笑う
to force a laugh

content:
わさび〔山葵〕
〈名〉The wild horse-radish

content.content: 山葵が利いた
The horse-radish makes me cry.
西洋山葵
the horse-radish
卸し山葵
grated horse-radish
山葵卸し
a horse-radish grater
山葵醤油
horse-radish sauce
山葵漬
pickled horse-radishes

わざもの〔業物〕
〈名〉A trenchant blade

content:
わざわい〔禍〕
〈名〉Evil; harm; woe; a misfortune; a calamity; a disaster

content.content: 禍に逢う
to come to harm―come to woe―meet with a misfortune
禍に罹る
to suffer from a disaster
禍を招く
to bring a calamity on oneself―invite disaster―fly in the face of Providence
それは自ら招いた禍だ
You have brought the calamity on yourself.
禍を避ける
to keep off evil―keep out of harm's way―avert a calamity―fend off a disaster―ward off a disaster
そんなことをすると後の禍を招くおそれがある
Such a step may be attended with serious consequences.
生かしておくは後日の禍
If he lives, he will make trouble.
君がもっと注意さえしたらこんな禍は無かったのだに
If you had been more careful, this calamity would not have happened.
禍なる哉
Woe is me!
そんな女を妻にした人こそ禍なる哉だ
Woe to the man who marries such a woman!
この日は禍なる哉(いかなる悪日ぞ)
Woe worth the day!
口は禍の門
“Out of the mouth proceeds evil.”
福と禍
good and evil―weal and woe
福あれば禍あり
“Where there is good, there is evil.”
禍転じて福となる
“Good comes out of evil.”
禍を転じて福となす
to make good out of evil
禍も三年経てば役に立つ
“Keep a thing seven years, and you will have a use for it.”
不測の禍
a mishap―an accident
禍を未発に防ぐ
to nip an evil in the bud―destroy an evil in the egg

content:
わざわざ〔態々〕
〈副〉
1. Expressly; for the express purpose (of doing something)

content.content: この提灯はそのためにわざわざ誂えてこしらえさしたのだ
These lanterns were expressly made to order for the occasion.
わざわざ君に会いに来たのだ
I came for the express purpose of seeing you.
わざわざ傘を返しに来たのか
Have you come for the purpose of returning the umbrella?
わざわざ何々する
to take the trouble to do something―go to the trouble of doing something―be at the trouble of doing something―go out of one's way to do something―put oneself out of one's way to do something
わざわざ来なくとも手紙でよかったに
You might have written, instead of taking the trouble to come.
遠路のところをわざわざお出で下さいましてまことにありがとう
Thank you kindly for taking the trouble to come all this way―I am greatly obliged to you for your trouble in coming all this way.
わざわざ遠路をお出でになったのだから君だけは破格にしよう
Since you have been at the trouble of coming all this way, I will make an exception in your favour.
その国の言葉を学ぶもよいがわざわざ教師を雇うには及ぶまい
It is all very well to learn the language of the country, but you need not go to the trouble and expense of engaging a teacher for the purpose.
わざわざその本を買うに及ばぬ
You need not go to the expense of buying the book.
わざわざ聞きに行くほどの演説でもない
I would not go out of my way to hear him.
わざわざ見に行く価値は無い
It is not worth going out of your way to see it.
(食事が始まるところへ行き合わして)私のためにわざわざ用意するのはお止しなさい
Please don't put yourself out of your way on my account.

an eaglet

an aerie

to clutch anything

content:
わしる〔走る〕
〈自動〉To run

content.content: 馬走る
A horse got loose.

content:
わしん〔和親〕
〈名〉Friendly relations; friendship; amity; entente cordiale

content.content: 和親を結ぶ
to enter into friendly relations with one Power

a friendly power

content:
わずか〔僅〕
〈名〉(数なら)a small number:(量なら)a small quantity:(金なら)a small sum; a small amount:(程度なら)a small extent; a slight degree:(時なら)a short time; a little while:(距離なら)a little way:(事物なら)a small matter; a trifling matter; a trifle:(副詞に用いれば)only:(=の) a few (books); a little (money); small (salary); trifling (matter); scanty (pay); slender (income); slight (wound); short (time)

content.content: 金はわずか有る
I have a little money―some little money.
金はわずかしか無い
I have little money―but little money―only a little money.
わずかの金を資本に商売を始めた
I started a business with a little money―with a small sum of money.
本はわずか有る
I have a few books―some few books.
本はわずかしか無い
I have few books―but few books―only a few books.
わずかなことだ
It is a small matter―a trifling matter―a trifle.
彼はわずかなことで立腹する
He takes offence at trifles.
わずかなことで騒ぎ立てる
He makes a fuss about trifles―makes much ado about nothing.
わずかな収入だ
He has a small income―a slender income.
わずかな給料だ
He has a small salary―scanty pay―a pittance.
わずかな給料を貰って働いている
He works for a pittance.
わずかな給料で食うや食わずだ
He starves on scanty pay.
この品にはキズがわずかある
The article has a slight flaw.
儲けはわずかしかない
I gain only a little―but little.
その村には人家がわずかしかない
The village has only a few houses―but few houses.
これから海までわずかしか無い
It is only a little way to the sea.
わずかだがこれを上げる
Here is a trifle for you―Here is something for you.
この本はわずかの時日でできた
The book was written in a short time.
わずか一年でできた
It was written in only a year―in the short space of a year.
彼はわずかのことで勝った
He won by a trifle―won by a head.
彼はわずかに三年洋行しただけだ
He studied abroad only a few years.
わずかに二つ三つしかない
There are only two or three―not more than two or three.
わずか一分のことで汽車に乗り後れた
I missed the train by only one minute.
あの金持ちが僅か五円寄付とはひどい
It is too mean in a man of his wealth to give only five yen.
俺も先がわずかになった
I have not long to live―I am not long for this world.

content:
わずかに〔僅に〕
〈副〉Barely; narrowly

content.content: わずかに免る
to have a bare escape―have a narrow escape
わずかに難を免れた
He barely escaped the danger―He had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
わずかに身をもって免れた
He escaped with bare life.
彼はわずかに暮らしを立てている
He makes a bare living―picks up a scanty livelihood.
結果はわずかに期待に応ずるのみ
The result barely answers my expectations.

content:
わずらい〔煩い〕
〈名〉
1. (=病気)illness; sickness

content.content: 長煩い
a long illness―a protracted illness
彼は長煩いをして治ったばかりだ
He has just recovered from a long illness.

content: 2. (=煩労)trouble

content.content: この煩いを免れたらありがたい
I should be glad to be relieved of this trouble.
仕事を引き受けて煩いを増やした
I have added to my trouble by undertaking the work.
また新著述を出して世間の煩いを増やした
I have inflicted another work on the long-suffering public.

content: 3. (=煩悩)annoyance; affliction; agony; worry

わずらう〔煩う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=思い煩う)to be troubled (about a matter); to be distressed (about a matter); to be worried (about the examination); to be oppressed with doubts and anxieties
2. (=病気する)to be ill:(米国にては)to be sick

content.content: 彼は始終煩っている
He is always ill―constantly ailing.
僕は一日も煩ったことが無い
I never had a day's illness―I never was ill in my life.
彼は長く煩っている
He has long been ill.
長く煩って死んだ
He died after a long illness.
そう長く煩わないで死んだ
He died after a rather short illness.

content: 〈他動〉(=何病を患える)to suffer from (a disease); to be afflicted with (a disease); to be troubled with (a disease); to be ill with (a fever)

content.content: 君は肺を煩ったことがあるか
Did you ever suffer from consumption?
彼は目を煩っている
He is suffering from an eye-disease―troubled with an eye-disease.
僕は痔を煩っている
I am afflicted with piles.

content:
わずらわしい〔煩わしい〕
〈形〉
1. (=面倒臭い)troublesome; irksome

content.content: 漢字は学ぶに煩わしい
Chinese characters are troublesome to learn.
家事は煩わしいからいっこうかまわない
I do not trouble myself about―trouble my head about―household matters.

content: 2. (=繁雑な)complicated, tangled, labyrinthine (affair); intricate (problem); complex (structure); involved (style, etc.)

わずらわす〔煩わす〕
〈他動〉
1. To trouble (one); to worry (one); to bother (one); to exercise (one); to tax, task (the memory, etc.)

content.content: 毎度お手数を煩わして済みません
I am sorry to give you trouble so offten.
君を煩わすほどのことでもない
The matter is not worth troubling you about.
試験で心を煩わしている
I am worried about the examination.
そんなことで心を煩わすことはない
You need not worry about such matters.
質問には煩わされる
I am troubled with questions―bothered with questions.
緻密に過ぎると記憶力を煩わす
Over-minuteness taxes the memory.

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: このことは誰に聞いてもわからないからあなたを煩わす次第です
No one can satisfy me on this point, so I must turn to you for explanation.
暫時の間、清聴を煩わします
I shall tresspass on your patience for a while.
会長の任は知事を煩わすことに致しました
We have asked the governor to be president of the society.
きまり次第ご一報を煩わしたい
You will please let me know as soon as it is decided.
明日事務所までご足労を煩わしたい
You will please come to the office―call at the office―tomorrow.

content:
わする〔和する〕
〈自動〉
1. (=和合する)to harmonize; to be in harmony; to be in concord

content.content: 夫婦相和す
Husband and wife should live in concord.

content: 2. (=和睦する)to make peace (with the enemy)

content.content: 源平相い和して第三者に当たる
to make common cause with each other against a new enemy

content: 3. (=合唱する)to sing in concert; to sing in unison

content.content: 一人が「君が代」を歌うと他は皆これに和して歌う
One sings the Kimiyago, and the others sing in unison.

content: 4. (=付いて行う)to follow (an example)

content.content: 人皆これに和す
Everybody else followed suit.

content:
わすれがち〔忘れ勝〕
〈形〉Forgetful; oblivious; negligent; unmindful

content.content: 事務多忙だととかく仏のことは忘れがちなにる
Press of business makes one forgetful of religion.

わすれぐさ〔忘れ草〕
〈名〉
1. The day-lily
2. (=煙草)tobacco

content:
わすれっぽい〔忘れっぽい〕
〈形〉Forgetful; apt to forget

content.content: 僕は忘れっぽくて困る、始終人の名を忘れる
I have a bad memory―a short memory. I am constantly forgetting people's names.
年をとると忘れっぽくなる
One's memory fails (one) with age.
年のせいか忘れっぽくなって困る
My memory begins to fail me―Age tells on my memory.

わすれなぐさ〔忘れな草〕
〈名〉The forget-me-not

content:
わすれもの〔忘れ物〕
〈名〉Anything forgotten; anything left behind

content.content: 忘れ者をする
to forget something―leave something behind
電車へ忘れ物をしてきた
I have forgotten something in the car.
お忘れ物の無いように
Please see that you leave nothing behind.

content:
わすれる〔忘れる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=失念する)to forget; to be forgetful of, be oblivious of (anything)

content.content: 忘れられる
to be forgotten―pass out of mind―pass out of one's memory―fade from one's memory―escape one's memory―slip one's memory―fall into oblivion―be buried in oblivion
あのことはすっかり忘れてしまった
I have forgotten all about it―It has completely passed from my memory.
その名を忘れてしまった
I have forgotten his name―I can not recollect his name―He name has escaped my memory.
その名をちょいと忘れた
I forget his name―I do not remember his name―His name has slipped my memory.
名を聞いてもすぐに忘れる
I forget a name as soon as I hear it―I have a bad memory for names.
その人の名は世に忘れられている
His name has faded from the memory of the world―He has fallen into oblivion.
たいがいの人は死ぬと世に忘れられてしまう
Most names are buried in oblivion.
世人なお彼の名を忘れず
His memory still lives―He still lives in the memory of people.
子どもが僕の顔を忘れない
The child remembers my face.
彼は外国人だということを忘れてはならぬ
You must remember―You must not lose sight of the fact―that he is a foreigner.
このご恩は生涯忘れません
I shall never forget your kindness―I shall remember your kindness the longest day I have to live.
子どもらは何事も忘れて余念無く遊んでいる
The children are absorbed in play, forgetful of everything―oblivious of everything.
あなたのことは片時も忘れません(忘れねばこそ思い出さず候)
You are ever present to my mind.
思い出す様じゃ
If you recollect your love,
惚れ様が足らぬ
You do not love enough;
思い出さずに
Be ever present to your mind
忘れずに
The object of your love!
忘れたことを身をつねって思い出す
to refresh one's memory―jog one's memory―fillip up one's memory―touch up one's memory
あの日のことをまだ忘れぬ
I still remember the day―The day is still fresh in my memory.
あの日のことはとても忘れらぬ
The day is not to be forgotten―deeply impressed on my memory.
あの出来事は胆に銘じて忘れられぬ
The event is indelibly impressed on my mind.
あの怖い目に逢ったのがどうしても忘れられぬ
That terrible experience haunts my memory.
あの恐ろしい顔が忘れられぬ、忘れることができない顔だ
His frightful face haunts my memory―It is a never-to-be-forgotten face.
彼女の面影が目にちらついて忘れられぬ
Her face is ever present to my senses.
僕は素志を片時も忘れられぬ
I have ever kept my object in view.
これら十カ条の金言を片時も忘れるな
“Ever remember these precepts ten.”
このことを常に心に掛けて忘れてはならぬ
You must keep this fact in mind―bear this fact in mind.
このことは胆に銘じて忘れてはならぬ
You must have this fact impressed on your mind.
このことは明け暮れ忘れぬ、寝ても起きても忘れぬ
I never forget the matter awake or asleep―The idea forms part of myself.
専門は寝ても起きても忘れるな
You must live your profession.
約束を忘れてはいけませんよ
You must not forget your promise―I must remind you of your promise.
日本へ来遊したことを忘れぬように何か買って行きましょう
I will buy something to remind me of my visit to Japan―as a souvenir of my visit to Japan.
何に何を忘る
to forget one thing in another
何に寝食を忘る
to forget food and sleep in something―forget everything in something―be absorbed in something―be engrossed in something
読書に寝食を忘る
I forget food and sleep in reading―Reading is meat and drink to me.
彼は国事に寝食を忘れている
He is engrossed in the affairs of state.
寝食を忘れて学問をしている
He is absorbed in his studies.
彼女は寝食を忘れて病人を看護した
She nursed the invalid, forgetful of everything.
熱心のあまり用心を忘れるな
You must not forget your caution in your zeal―(他動詞構文にすれば)―You zeal must not outrun your caution.
働いていると苦労を忘れる
I forget my care in my work―(他動詞構文にすれは)―Work diverts my mind from care.
忘れもしない彼に初めて逢ったのは七年前のことだ
I well remember the first time I met him, it was seven years ago.
(彼の短所を挙げると同時に)彼の長所を挙げることを忘れてはならぬ
I must not forget―must not omit―to mention his merits.
この薬を一滴飲むと痛みがたちまち忘れたように治る
Swallow a drop of this medicine, and the pain will be gone in a moment.
あの薬を付けたら歯の痛いのが忘れたように治った
The medicine has made me forget my toothache.
治に在りて乱を忘れず
Forget not war in time of peace―Always be prepared for war.
咽もと過ぐれば熱さを忘る、雨晴れて傘を忘る
“Danger past, God forgotten.”

content: 2. (=忘れて行く、忘れて来る、置き忘れる)to forget (anything); to leave (anything)

content.content: 僕は帽子をどこへ忘れて来たかしら
Where can I have left my hat?
君のところへ傘を忘れて来はしないか
Didn't I leave my umbrella at your place?
誰か傘を忘れて行った人がある
Somebody has forgotten his (or her) umbrella.

content: 3. (=わざと忘れる、念頭より去る)to dismiss (anything) from one's mind; to banish (anything) from one's memory; to take one's mind off, keep one's mind off (anything); to put (anything) out of one's mind; to think no more of (anything)

content.content: そんなことは忘れてしまえ
Dismiss the matter from your mind!―Think no more of it!
あのことは忘れようと思っても忘れられぬ、忘れんとして忘るるあたわず
I can not banish the matter from my memory―put the matter out of my mind―keep my mind off the matter.
苦労を忘れよ
Banish care!
酒を飲んで苦労を忘れる
to drown care in wine
彼と別れるとそのことをすっかり忘れてしまった
I parted from him, and thought no more of the matter.

content: 4. (=見落す)to overlook; to lose sight of (a fact); to leave (anything) out of account; to leave (anything) out of consideration

content.content: この事実を忘れてはならぬ
We must not overlook this fact―lose sight of this fact.
道が遠くなったのを忘れておった
I left the greater distance out of account.
彼の成功を論ずるに当たって彼の若年なることを忘れてはならぬ
In considering his success, we must not leave his youth out of consideration.

content:
〈名〉

1. (=引渡す)to hand (one anything); to deliver (goods); to pay (one money); to give (one anything); to hand over, deliver over (anything to one); to make over, transfer, remise (property to one); to give up, deliver up, resign, surrender, remise (a right to another); to turn over, transfer, surrender (a business to one)

content.content: その品は手もとにあるからいつでもお渡し申します
The article is in my possession, and I am ready to hand it over to you.
金は確かにお渡し申しました

What have you done with the money I gave you?

We will deliver the goods in exchange for cash.

He has turned over―transferred―surrendered―his business to his creditors.

右金額正にお預かり申候御入用の節は此証引換にお渡し可申候{みぎきんがくまさにおあずかりもうしそうろう、ごにゅうようのせつはこのしょうひきかえにおわたしもうすべくろうろう}
We have received the above sum on deposit, and promise to pay you the same on demand in exchange for this receipt.

Tobacco was introduced into Japan by the Portuguese.

There are many ways of walking through life, which are called walks of life.
どうかこうか世を渡る

content:

〈自動〉To extend (over so many miles―over so many years); to range (over a wide field―between A and B―from A to B); to cover (so much ground); to last (so many hours); to span (so many years); to enter into (details, etc.)

content.content: 明治天皇の御宇は殆ど半世紀に亙った

彼の思想は過去、現在、未来に亙っている

content:
わび〔詫〕
〈名〉An apology:(人の為なら)intercession:(=る、=する) to apologize (to a man for one's fault); to beg pardon (of man for one's fault); to acknowledge (one's fault):(人の為なら)to intercede (with one in behalf of the culprit)

content.content: お詫びをしなければならない
I must apologize―I must offer you apology―I owe you an apology.
悪いことを致しましたお詫びを致します
I beg your pardon for what I have done―I apologize for my fault―I acknowledge my fault.
不行き届きの段は幾重にもお詫びを致します
I beg a thousand pardons for my negligence.
ご無沙汰の罪をお詫びしなければなりません
I must apologize for my long silence.
お詫びのしようがありません

詫びをしなくては先で承知しまい

なにも詫びることは無い

content.content: 笑いを漏らす
to give vent to a laugh―laugh―betray a smile―smile
世間の笑いを招く
to get laughed at―expose oneself to ridicule
そんなことをすると笑いを招くばかりだ
You will only get laughed at for your pains―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your conduct will expose you to ridicule.
笑いの種にする

あの人は何でも笑いの種にするから怖がられる

彼のおどし文句を笑いであしらった

このことでは大笑いさ

高笑い

皆ドッと高笑いした

泣き笑いする
to smile through one's tears
苦笑い

苦笑いする

空笑い
a forced laugh
クスクス笑い(する)
a titter―to titter
ばか笑い
a horse-laugh
豪傑笑い
a grim laugh
せせら笑い
derisive laughter―a sardonic laugh
思い出し笑い
a quiet laugh (over something past)
あの時のことを考えて時々思い出し笑いする
When I think of that affair, I often enjoy a quiet laugh over it.

content:
わらいがお〔笑い顔〕
〈名〉A smile

content.content: 笑い顔をする
to smile
日本の婦人は誰に逢っても笑い顔をする
A Japanese lady has a smile for everybody.
あの娘は可愛らしい笑い顔をする
She has a sweet smile.
女が笑い顔をして男を迎えた
She smiled at him―smiled on him―smiled him a welcome.
凄い笑い顔
a ghastly smile―a grim smile
彼は凄い笑い顔をして自分の家の焼けるのを眺めておった
He stood gazing at his burning house with a grim smile.
人々は苦々しい笑い顔をして彼の暴状を見ている
People look at his excesses with a scandalized smile.
妻の笑い顔を見ると夫は苦労を忘れる
The wife smiles her husband's cares away.
悲しさ隠す笑い顔
She smiles to conceal her tears―keeps up a fictitious gaily.

content:
わらいぐさ〔笑い草〕
〈名〉A laughing-stock; a standing jest; a standing joke; a subject for ridicule; a butt for ridicule; an object of derision

content.content: 彼は学校中の笑い草だ
He is the laughing-stock of the whole school.
あの人の妙な癖はいつも笑い草だ
His odd ways are a standing jest―a standing joke.
まあ好い笑い草じゃないか
What a subject for ridicule!
笑い草にする
to turn anything into ridicule
あの人はなんでもかんでも笑い草にするから人に怖がられる
He makes himself feared by a habit of turning things into ridicule.
都下の新聞は彼を嘲弄して世間の笑い草にした
The town papers held him up to the derision of the public.
そんなことをすると世間の笑い草になるぞ
You will make a fool of yourself―make an ass of yourself―make a show of yourself―make an exhibition of yourself.

わらいくずれる〔笑い崩れる〕
〈自動〉To laugh oneself limp and helpless

content:
わらいごえ〔笑い声〕
〈名〉Laughter

content.content: 大きな笑い声が起こった
There arose a roar of laughter―a peal of laughter.
皆の陽気な笑い声が聞こえる
I hear their merry laughter.
女が凄い笑い声を出す
She laughs a hysterical laugh.
狂人の笑い声は凄い
A madman laughs an unearthly laugh.

content:
わらいごと〔笑い事〕
〈名〉A laughing matter

content.content: 笑い事じゃないよ
It is no laughing matter, I can tell you.

わらいじょうご〔笑い上戸〕
〈名〉A merry drinker:(より)a man of indomitable good spirits

content:
わらいだす〔笑い出す〕
〈自動〉To fall to laughing; to break into a laugh; to burst into laughter; to burst out laughing

content.content: 冗談を言うと皆笑い出した
They fell to laughing over my joke―(他動詞構文にすれば)―My joke set them laughing.

content:
わらいもの〔笑い物〕

content.content: わらいぐさ〔笑い草〕

content:
わらいよう〔笑い様〕
〈名〉A manner of laughing; a manner of smiling

content.content: あやふやな笑いようをする
to smile a dubious smile
人をばかにしたような笑いようをする
to smile a contemptuous smile
君はずいぶん皮肉な笑いようをするね
You laugh a sardonic laugh.

content:
わらう〔笑う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=声を出して笑う)to laugh; to make merry

content.content: 人を笑う
to laugh at people
皆君のことを笑っているぜ
They are laughing at you―making merry at your expense.
呵々と笑う
to laugh loudly―roar with laughter
クスクス笑う
to titter
独りで笑う
to laugh to oneself
独りでクスクス笑う
to chuckle to oneself
ゲスゲス笑う、ゲラゲラ笑う
to giggle―snigger
キャッキャッ笑う
to scream with laughter―screech with laughter―shriek with laughter
皆ドッと笑った
They burst into laughter―burst into a roar of laughter.
幇間が一座をドッと笑わせる
A buffoon sets the table in a roar.
止めどなく笑う
to have a fit of laughing
死ぬほど笑う
to die with laughing―laugh oneself to death
転げまわって笑った
I rolled about in convulsions of laughter.
腹を抱えて笑う
to hold one's sides with laughter
腹の皮をよじって笑う
to split one's sides with laughing―shake one's sides with laughing
あまり笑ってゲンナリする
to laugh oneself limp and helpless
あまり笑ってゲンナリした
I am weak and limp with laughing.
顎をはずして笑う
to laugh one's jaws out of joint
あまり笑って涙が出る
to laugh till the tears come―laugh till one cries
泣いたり笑ったりした
He laughed and cried by turns.
内証で笑う、腹の中で笑う
to laugh in one's sleeve
無理に笑う
to force a laugh
鼻で笑う
to laugh a contemptuous laugh―sneer (at people)
冗談を言って笑う
to joke―jest
冗談を言うと皆笑った
They laughed over the joke.
人が失錯をすると皆笑う
They laugh over a mistake.
手を拍って笑った
He chapped his hands for joy.
笑って承諾する
to laugh one's consent
間違いなどを笑ってごまかす
to laugh off a mistake
笑って人を黙らせる
to laugh one down
笑って苦労をまぎらす
to laugh care away
笑って腹の立つのをまぎらす
to laugh off vexations
笑って事を済ます
to laugh a matter away
笑って済ませることじゃない
It is not a matter to be laughed away.
笑いながら議論をした
They argued in a laughing mood.
君達はなぜ笑っているか
What is the cause of your merriment?―What is the cause of your mirth?
笑わずにおれぬ(笑わざるを得ぬ)
I can not (choose) but laugh―I can not help laughing―I can not keep from laughter―I can not keep my gravity―I can not keep my countenance.
笑わずにいようと思うと骨が折れた
I had much ado to keep my gravity―had much ado to keep my countenance.
笑わずにおれるものか
How can I but laugh?―How can I help laughing?―How can I do otherwise than laugh?
おかしくとも我慢して笑わずにいた
I contained my laugh―kept my gravity―kept my countenance.
そのおかしな光景を見てとうとう我慢し切れないで笑った
I could not keep my gravity at the sight―The sight upset my gravity.
泣いて暮らすも一生笑って暮らすも一生
One may cry or laugh one's life away―Lead a merry life rather than a sad one.
笑う門に福来たる
Fortune enters at the merry door―“Laugh and grow fat.”
笑って損をした者は無い
No man was ever known to lose by laughing.
笑うほど薬は無い
Nothing does one more good than a good hearty laugh.
来年のことを言うと鬼が笑う
Next year is the devil's joke.
皆笑え笑え
Fie upon you!―Fie for shame!―Shame upon you!
皆笑え笑えと言って囃し立てる
to cry shame on one

content: 2. (=ニコニコ笑う、微笑する)to smile

content.content: あの人の笑った顔を見たことが無い
I never saw him smile.
赤児が僕の顔を見て笑う
The baby smiles at me.
女がニッコリ笑って男を迎えた
She smiled at him―smiled on him―smiled him a welcome.
ニッコリ笑って頷いた
She nodded assent with a smile.
ニッコリ笑って承知した
She smiled her consent.
彼のおどし文句くらい笑ってあしらう(怖いものか)
I smile at his threats.
老人がまわりに子どもを集めてニコニコ笑っている
The old man sits beaming on his grandchildren.
彼女はうわべで笑って腹の中で泣いている
She smiles to conceal her tears―keeps up a fictitious gaily.
人を笑わせる
to make one smile―provoke a smile

content: 3. (=ニヤニヤ笑う、歯をむき出して笑う)to grin

content.content: 彼は女の顔を見るとニヤニヤ笑う
He grins at women―grins like a baboon.
相好を崩して笑う
to grin broadly
皆相好を崩して笑っている
They are on the grin―on the broad grin.

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=あざけり笑う、嘲笑する)to laugh at, deride, ridicule (a man)

content.content: 人を笑うものでない
You should not laugh at people―make merry at other's expense.
皆君のことを笑っているぞ
Everybody is laughing at you―making merry at your expense.
(ばか者と)笑わば笑え、僕の信ずるところはどこまでも信ずる
Laugh at me as you will, I will not give up my belief―You can not laugh me out of my belief.
君はいくら笑っても僕は決心を翻さぬ
You can not laugh me out of my resolution.
なにも笑うことはない
There is nothing to laugh at.
自分のことを棚へ上げて人を笑う
“The pot calls the kettle black.”
人をせせら笑う
to deride a man―ridicule a man
笑われる
to get laughed at―make oneself ridiculous―expose oneself to ridicule
笑われるようなことをする
to make a fool oneself―make an ass of oneself―make a show of oneself―make an exhibition of oneself
そんなことをすると笑われるばかりだ
You will only get laughed at for your pains―You will be a fool for your pains―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your conduct will expose you to ridicule.
初めて東京へ出たとき田舎弁を笑われた
The first time I came to Tokyo, I was laughed at for my provincial dialect.
そんなことをすると笑われるから止せ
Do not make yourself ridiculous by doing such a thing―Do not make an ass of yourself!
笑うべき
a laughable affair―a ludicrous mistake―ridiculous conduct

content: 2. (=賞讃するに対し、非難する)to censure

content.content: 彼は賞められても笑われても平気だ
He is indifferent to praise or censure.
その志は賞すべくその行為は笑うべし
The motive is worthy of praise, but the deed deserves censure.

content.content: 家庭の和楽
the joys of home―the amenities of home life

content.content: 草鞋をはく
to put on travelling-sandals―(博徒などが夜逃げをするの意味なら)―leave a place in secret―decamp―abscond
(彼は土地を売って)長い草鞋をはく身となった

二足の草鞋ははけない
One can not do two things at a time.

草鞋がけで出かけた

content.content: 藁葺き屋根

content:

〈他動〉To make (one) laugh; to set (one) laughing; to tickle (one); to throw (one) into convulsions:(微笑なら)to make (one) smile; to provoke a smile; to elicit a smile:(おかしがらせるの意味なら)to upset one's gravity; to amuse (one)

content.content: 幇間が一座をドッと笑わせる
A buffoon sets the table in a roar.

The prisoner's statement was so funny that it upset the gravity of the judge.
あの男の大言には笑わせられた
I was tickled by his big talk.
老人は面白い話をして子どもらを笑わせている

The first time I came to Tokyo, I was laughed at for my provincial dialect.
そんなことをすると笑われるばかりだ
You will only get laughed at for your pains―You will be a fool for your pains―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your conduct will expose you to ridicule.
そんなことをすると笑われるから止せ

わらんべ〔童〕

content.content: わらべ〔童〕

content:
わり〔割〕
〈名〉
1. (=割合)rate

content.content: 利子年六分の割
interest at (the rate of) 6 percent per annum
一つ五円の割りに買った
I bought them at (the rate of) five yen apiece.
賃銀は一日三円五十銭の割りに払う
The wages are paid at the rate of 3 yen fifty sen a day.
教員の給料は一時間三円の割りに払う
We pay our teachers at the rate of three yen an hour.
君の学校は他の学校よりも給料の割りが好い
Your school pays better salaries than the other schools.
人口一千人に医者一人の割りだ
There is one doctor for every thousand inhabitants.
君はその割りでいったらじきに身代を使い果たすだろう
If you go on at that rate, you will go through your fortune in no time.

content: 2. (=何割)(how many) percent; percentage

content.content: 一割
ten percent (10%)
何割か
How many percent?―What is the percentage?
一割五分の利子が付く
It bears interest at 15 percent.
二割の配当をする
to pay a dividend of 20 percent
物価は去年より三割方騰貴した
The prices have risen by 30 percent since last year.
賃銀を五割引き上げた
The wages have been raised by 50 percent.
一割引き
10 percent discount
学生の何割成功するか
What is the percentage of students who succeed?

content: 3. (=利益)advantage

content.content: 割りの好い
(条件)advantageous terms―(商売)―a profitable business―(地位)―a lucrative post
割りの好い取引をする
to make an advantageous transaction―make a good deal―make a good bargain
割りの悪い
(条件)disadvantageous terms―(商売)―an unprofitable business
割りの悪い取引をする
to make a disadvantageous transaction―make a bad bargain
資本の無い者は何をしても割りが悪い
One who has no capital is at a disadvantage in doing anything.
外国人は何をしても割りが悪い
A foreigner is at a disadvantage―A foreigner labours under a disadvantage―in doing anything.
仕事は割りに合うか
Does the work pay?―Is the work worth your while?―Do you find your account in the work?
割りに合う仕事なら引き受ける
I will undertake the work if it pays.
割りに合わぬ
It does not pay―It is not worth my while―I do not find my account in it.
割りに合わない商売だ
It is not a paying business―“The game is not worth the candle.”
仕事を外へ出した方が割りが好い
It will pay better to put out the work.
骨を折った上に笑われちゃ割りに合ったもんじゃない
It does not pay to be laughed at for one's pains.
いくら金が儲かっても名誉を失っては割りに合わぬ(償いにならぬ)
No amount of gain can compensate for the loss of honour.
割りに合わぬ勝利
a Pyrrhic victory―a Cadmean victory

content: 4. (=効果)effect

content.content: この醤油は割りが利く
The soy is effective.

content: 5. (=割り当て、割り振り)assignment; allotment

content.content: 役割
assignment of parts―a cast of characters
役割をする
to assign a part to each―cast the parts to the actors―cast the actors for the parts

allotment of the rooms to the classes
教場割りをする
to allot the rooms to the classes
頭割り
capitation
金は頭割りに出そう
Let us each pay an equal share of the money.

content: 6. (=税)a rate

content.content: 戸数割り
a household rate

content: 〈副〉(=に) comparatively

content.content: フランス語は聞き取るのは困難だが話す方は割りにやさしい
It is difficult to follow French, but it is comparatively easy to speak it.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=に) in proportion to; for; considering

content.content: 月給割りに金を出そう
Let us give the money each in proportion to his salary.
収入の割りに金を出した
We gave each in proportion to his income.
大きさの割りに重い
It is heavy for its size.
大きい割りに軽い
It is light for its size―considering its size.
彼は年の割りに丈夫だ
He is strong for his age―considering his age.
年の若い割りに行き届いている
He is careful for a young man―considering his youth.
この酒は値段の割りに飲める
This wine drinks well for its price.

content:
わりあい〔割合〕
〈名〉

content.content: 七三の割合
the rate of 7 to 3―the proportion of 7 to 3

Let us divide the money in the proportion of 4 to 6.
利子の割合は(?)
What is the rate of interest?
出産と死亡の割合

What is the percentage of students who succeed in life?
賃銀は一日三円五十銭の割合に払う
The wages are paid at the rate of 3 yen 50 sen a day.
教員の給料は一時間三円の割合に払う
We pay our teachers at the rate of three yen an hour.

I bought them at (the rate of) five yen apiece.

There is one cock for every twenty hens.
利まわりは八分の割合になる

content: 2. (=勝敗の割合)chances; odds

What are the odds?―How are the chances?
勝ち目の割合は七三
The odds are 7 to 3 in our favour.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=に) in proportion to; for; considering

content.content: 収入の割合に金を出そう
