わりこむ〔割り込む〕
〈自動〉To wedge in; to squeeze in

content.content: どこかその辺へ割り込んで坐れんか
Can't you squeeze in somewhere about there?
ここへ割り込ましてくれ給え
Let me squeeze myself between you!
二人乗りの馬車へ割り込んで乗る
to ride bodkin―sit bodkin

わりした〔割下〕
〈名〉Diluted soy (for cocking beef, etc.)

わりだか〔割高〕
〈形〉Dear at the price

わりだけ〔割り竹〕
〈名〉Split bamboo

content:
わりだす〔割り出す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=打算する)to calculate, compute (from some data)

content.content: 何から割り出す
to calculate from some data―base one's calculation upon some data
これは何から割り出したものか
What data is the calculation based upon?
この数は何から割り出したのか
How do you get the figure?

content: 2. (=推断する)to conclude, deduce, infer (from some facts)

content.content: それは何から割り出した話か
What do you conclude it from?
あの人の話は皆自分の利益から割り出すのだ
His opinions are all deduced from interest―based upon interest.

content:
わりつけ〔割り付け〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: わりあて〔割り当て〕

content:
わりなき〔割無き〕
〈形〉Inseparable

content.content: 二人は割無き仲だ
They are inseparable―bound up in each other.

わりばし〔割箸〕
〈名〉(割らないうちは)unsplit chopsticks:(割ってからは)split chopsticks

content:
わりびき〔割引〕
〈名〉Discount; reduction:(=する) to discount; to reduce; to take (something off the price)

content.content: (銀行で)手形を割引する
to discount a note
割引手形
a discounted note
値段を割引する
to reduce the price
割引値段
a reduced price
割引して売る
to sell at reduced prices―sell at a discount―sell at a sacrifice
二割割引して売っている
They sell at reduction of 20 percent.
本校生徒に限り割引す
The prices are reduced for the students of this school only.
少し割引できませんか
Can't you take something off the price?
たくさん買ったら割引しますか
Do you make any reduction for quantity?
二割割引致します
I will take off 20 percent.
二割引
20 percent discount―20 percent reduction
賃銭を割引する
to reduce the fare
七時まで電車賃を割引する
The car-fares are reduced till seven.
割引電車賃
a reduced fare
割引時間
reduced-fare hours―rush hour
割引電車
a cheap car
割引切符
a reduced ticket―a cheap ticket
割引列車
a cheap train―(英国では)―a parliamentary train
団体割引
a reduction for parties
割引旅行
a cheap trip
割引旅行者
a cheap tripper
彼の話は割引して聞かなけりゃならん
His stories must be discounted―taken with a discount―taken with a grain of salt―taken with some grains of allowance.
割引銀行
a discount bank
割引業者
a discount house
割引手形仲立人
a discount bill broker
割引券
a discount coupon
割引市場
a discount market
割引歩合
a discount rate
仲間割引
trade discount
現金割引
prompt cash discount
現金なら割引しますか
Do you allow any discount for cash?

content:
わりふ〔割符〕
〈名〉A tally; a check

content.content: 割り符を合わすよう
They tally with each other―They are feature for feature alike.
割り符払い掛け売り法
tally system―tally trade
割符払い掛け売り店
a tally-shop

content:
わりふだ〔割札〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: わりふ〔割符〕

わりふり〔割り振り〕
〈名〉Assignment; allotment; apportionment; allocation

content:
わりふる〔割り振る〕
〈他動〉To assign (a part to each); to allot, apportion, allocate (a share to each)

content.content: 銘々に役を割り振る
to assign a part to each―cast the parts to the actors
銘々に割り前を割り振る
to allot a portion to each―apportion a share to each―allocate a share to each

content:
わりまえ〔割前〕
〈名〉A share; a portion; a part; a quota; an allotment; one's lot; one's shot:(各地方の出兵の割り前)a contingent

content.content: 割り前を出す
to pay one's share―bear one's share of the expenses―contribute one's quota
勘定の割り前を出そう
I'll pay my share of the reckoning―pay my shot.
割り前で一杯飲もうじゃないか
Let us have a drink, each to pay his own share!

content:
わりまし〔割増〕
〈名〉A premium:(賃銀などのは)an extra; an increase:(配当などのは)a bonus

content.content: 割り増しをする
(賃銀なら)to charge an extra―(配当なら)―give a bonus
雨天は五割増しです
We charge 50 percent extra in rainy weather.
割り増し金
a premium―a bonus
割り増しを出す
to offer a premium
割増付債券
premium-bearing debentures

content:
わりもどし〔割戻し〕
〈名〉Drawback; rebate

content.content: 割り戻し金
a drawback―(保険会社のは)―a bonus

わりもどす〔割戻す〕
〈自他動〉To allow a drawback; to rebate

わりやす〔割安〕
〈形〉Cheap at the price

content:
わる〔悪〕
〈名〉A knave; a rogue; a rascal; a scoundrel; a villain; a sharper

content.content: あの弁護士は評判の悪だ
That lawyer is a notorious villain.
悪になる
to turn sharper

content:
わる〔割る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=除す)to divide

content.content: 三で十を割る
to divide 10 by 3
十は三で割れない
10 is indivisible by 3.
十は二では割れる
10 is divisible by 2.

content: 2. (=分かつ)to divide

content.content: 二つに割る
to divide anything into two parts
この金を三つに割って一つずつ取ろう
Let us divide the money into three parts, and each take one part.

content: 3. (=裂く)to split; to cleave

content.content: 薪を割る
to split word
竹を割る
to split a bamboo
竹を割ったような男だ
He is a frank and open-hearted man.
口を割って飲ませる
to prise one's mouth open and pour down the wine―force a man to drink against his will

content: 4. (=こわす)to break; to crack

content.content: 卵を割る
to break an egg
卵を割って鍋へ落とす
to break eggs into a pan
胡桃を割る
to crack a nut
石を割る
to break stones
女中が皿を割った
The servant has broken a plate.
頭を割る
to break one's head
彼は人とけんかして頭を割られた
He fought with a man, and had his head broken.

content: 5. (=水を割る)to dilute (anything) with water; to mix (anything) with water; to dash (wine) with water; to grog (spirits)

content.content: ブランデイに水を割る
to mix brandy with water
水を割ったブランデイ
brandy and water
ブランデイに水を割って一杯くれ
Give me a glass of brandy and water.
葡萄酒に水を割る
to dash wine with water
彼は食事の時に葡萄酒に水を割って飲む
He takes wine dashed with water at his meals.
水を割った火酒
grog

content: 6. (=間を裂く)to estrange (two friends)

content.content: 二人の仲を割ったのはあの男だ
He came between the two friends.

content: 7. (=以下に下がる)to fall below (a level)

content.content: 米は一時は三十円台を割った
Rice once fell below the 30 yen level.
心の底を割る
to open one's heart

content:
わるあそび〔悪遊び〕
〈名〉Vicious pleasure; evil pleasures; evil courses; dissipation; debauchery

content.content: 悪遊びをする
to engage in vicious pleasures―fall into evil courses―indulge in dissipation and debauchery
彼は近頃悪遊びを始めた
He has taken to evil courses.

content:
わるい〔悪い〕
〈形〉
1. Bad (man or thing); ill (omen); evil (design); wicked (heart); wrong (action); black (heart); inferior (article); coarse (fish); defective (construction); harmful (act); ugly (man); plain, homely, ill-favoured (woman); unfavourable (times); spoilt (egg); tainted (meat, etc.) ［注意］“Bad”,“ill”は次の如く変化す―bad, worse, worst―ill, worse, worst

content.content: なお悪い、もっと悪い
worse
最も悪い、一番悪い
the worst
悪い人
a bad man―a wicked man
君は僕をだまして悪い人だ
You are a bad man to deceive me.
お前は女の子をからかって悪い子だ
You are a bad boy to tease a girl.
あれは悪い奴だ
He is a knave―a rogue―a rascal―a scoundrel―a villain―a blackguard―a bad lot.
彼は評判ほど悪くない
He is not so black as he is painted―“The devil is not so black as he is painted.”
悪い友達
a bad companion
彼は悪い友達ができた
He has got into bad company.
悪い道
bad roads―(邪道の意味なら)―evil ways―evil courses
悪い道には入りやすい
One is apt to fall into evil courses.
悪い病
a bad disease―a malignant disease―a virulent disease
悪い風邪を引いた
I have a bad cold.
彼は悪い熱病だ
He is suffering from a malignant fever.
悪い天気だ
It is bat weather―foul weather―inclement weather.
悪い便り
bad news―ill news―sad news
悪い前兆
a bad omen―an ill omen
今日は悪い日だ
This is an evil day―an unlucky day.
悪い気候
a bad climate―an unhealthy climate
悪い食物
bad food―unwholesome food
悪い空気
bad air―insalubrious air
悪い魚
(食えないの意味なら)a coarse fish―(悪くなったの意味なら)―tainted fish
悪い卵
a spoilt egg
悪い発音
a bad pronunciation―(間違ったの意味なら)―a wrong pronunciation
悪い品
a bad article―(劣等の意味なら)―an inferior article―(粗悪の意味なら)―a coarse article
(男振りの)悪い男
an ugly man
(女振りの)悪い女
a plain woman―a homely woman―an ill-favoured girl
悪い時に来た
I have come at the wrong moment―at an unfortunate moment.
(酒を止めたはよいが焼酎を始めた)そりゃますます悪い
That is going from bad to worse.
善い後は悪い
Every good has its evil―Every weal has its woe―Every day has its night―Every flow has its ebb.
悪いこと
a bad thing―(悪事なら)―an evil deed―a dark deed―a crime―(間違ったこと、不正なことなら)―a wrong―(宗教道徳上の罪悪なら)―a sin―a vice―(凶事なら)―an evil―a misfortune―a calamity―(いたずらなら)―harm―mischief―(過失なら)―a fault
悪いことをする

(悪事なら)to do evil―commit a crime―perpetrate a crime―do an evil deed―(間違ったこと、不正なことなら)―do wrong―(宗教道徳上の罪悪なら)―commit a sin―sin―indulge in a vice―(いたずらなら)―do harm―do mischief―get into mischief―(過失なら)―commit a fault
彼は悪いことを仕尽した
He has done every evil deed in his power―left no evil deed undone―completed the list of crimes―fill up the measure of crimes―run through all crimes―ranged over the whole gamut of crimes.
悪いことを致しました済みません
I am sorry for what I have done―I acknowledge my fault.
悪いことをして気が済まない
I have a sin on my conscience.
彼は悪いことをして牢へ入ったことがある
He once committed a crime and was put in prison―He was once caught tripping and deservedly dealt with.
彼は悪いことをして放逐された
He was dismissed in disgrace.
子どもは今日悪いことをして叱られたのだ
The boy has been reproved for doing mischief―He is in trouble―in a scrape―today.
あれはどんな悪いこともしかねない男だ
He is capable of anything.
どんな悪いことでも平気でする
He will stick at nothing.
悪いことをすると顕れる
“Murder will out.”
悪いことが顕れた
“The murder is out.”
悪いことはできないものだなー
My signs have found me out.
悪いことを慎む
to eschew evil
悪いことはじきに覚える
One learns to do evil soon enough.
あの人は子どもに悪いことを教える
He will lead a boy into mischief.
子どもは忙しいと悪いことをしない
Keep a boy busy, and you keep him out of mischief.
悪いことは酒から始まる
Drinking leads to other vices.
悪いことを知りつつ戯れる
to dally with temptations
悪いことと知りつつ彼の依頼に応じた
I complied with his request against my better judgement.
悪い時には悪いことが続く
“Misfortunes never come singly.”
近頃悪いことが続く
One calamity follows on the heels of another.
悪いことは言わないから止し給え
Take my advice, and give up the idea!
あの人は何か悪いことがあるか
Is there anything wrong about him?―Is there anything against him?
あの人の悪いことは何も知らない
I know nothing against him.
君の一番に悪いことは何事も半途にする癖だ
The worst thing about you is, that you do everything by halves.
なおさら悪いことには病人までもできた
What made matters worse,―To make matters worse,―one of them fell ill.

content: 3. (=何が悪い)［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 天気が悪い
The weather is bad―It is bad weather―foul weather―inclement weather―beastly weather.
道が悪い
The roads are bad―The roads are execrable.
雨が降って道が悪い
The rain has made the roads muddy.
品行が悪い
He is ill-conducted―a loose liver.
友達が悪い
He keeps bad company―He is in bad company.
意地が悪い、根性が悪い
He is ill-natured.
彼は僕のことをそんな悪口を言うとは意地が悪い
It is ill-natured of him to say such things of me.
人が悪い
He is malicious.
人中ですっぱ抜くとは人が悪い
It is malicious of him to expose people in public.
人を困らして悦んでいるとは人が悪い
He takes a malicious pleasure in annoying people.
彼は口がわるい
He has a foul tongue.
口の悪い男だ
He is foul-tongued―foul-mouthed.
君は口が悪いから人を怒らせるのだ
Your tongue gives offence.
君はずいぶん口が悪いね
You put it strong.
彼は口ほど悪くない
He is not so black as he paints himself.
心が悪い、腹が悪い
He has an evil mind―a black heart.
腹の悪い男だ
He is an evil-minded man―a black-hearted man.
僕は記憶が悪い
I have a bad memory―a poor memory.
彼は身体が悪い
He is ill―sick―indisposed―in ill health―out of health.
母は身体が悪くて臥しております
Mother is laid up with an illness―ill abed.
いつからお悪いのですか
How long has she been ill?
彼は病気が悪い
His illness has taken a turn for the worse.
肺が悪い
He is consumptive.
胃が悪い
He has a disordered stomach.
心臓が悪い
He has a heart complaint.
君はどこが悪いのか
What is the matter with you?
子どもはどこが悪いのか
What ails the child?
目が悪い
He has bad eyes.
喉が悪い
He has a sore throat.
足が悪い
He is lame.
頭が悪い
He has a muddled head―He is muddled-headed.
気分が悪い
I feel unwell―feel poorly―feel out of sorts.
気持が悪い
I feel badly―feel sick.
人を害すると気持ちが悪い
I feel badly when I have injured a man.
血を見ると気持が悪い
The sight of blood makes me feel sick.
君は血色が悪い、顔色が悪い
You look sallow―look blue about the gills.
この魚は生きが悪い
This fish looks blue about the gills.
胸が悪い
I feel nausea―feel queasy―feel sick.
見ると胸が悪い
The sight is nauseating―sickening―disgusting―My gorge rises at the sight―My stomach turns at the sight.
ご機嫌が悪い
He is in ill humour―in bad humour―out of humour―cross―as cross as two sticks.
この時計は具合が悪い
The watch is out of order―out of repair.
運が悪い
He is unfortunate―unlucky―ill-starred.
前兆が悪い、縁起が悪い
It is ill-omened―ominous―sinister―unlucky.
日が悪い
The days is unlucky.
二人は仲が悪い
They are on bad terms with each other―There is no love lost between them.
その時間は都合が悪い
The hour is inconvenient to me.
この家は勝手が悪い
It is an incommodious house.
匂いが悪い
It has a bad smell―It stinks.
惜しいことには文章が悪い
It is a pity the style is bad.
この本は文章が悪い
The book is written in a poor style.
そんなことをしては外聞が悪い
Such conduct would be disreputable―scandalous.
そんなことを言うと人聞きが悪い
What you say, concerns my reputation.
英語が話せないのはやり方が悪いからだ
You can not speak English, for you go about it in the wrong way.
この船は構造が悪い
The ship is defective in construction.
時期が悪い
The times are unfavourable.
品が悪い
It is of bad quality―of poor quality―inferior in quality.
価も安いし品も悪い
It is cheap and nasty.
義理が悪い
It is unjust―not fair.
男振りが悪い
He is ugly.
女が悪い
She is a plain woman―a homely woman―ill-favoured.
彼も悪いが端がなお悪い
He is “more sinned against than sinning.”
君の話はいつも後が悪い
Your remark always has a bad conclusion.
この品はどこが悪いか
What is wrong with―What is amiss with―the article?
機械にどこか悪いところがあるのか
Is there anything wrong with the machine?
この計画にどこか悪いところがあるのか
Is there anything amiss with the plan?―Is there anything against the plan?

content: 4. (=何に悪い)bad (for something)

content.content: 身体に悪い
It is bad for the health―injurious to health.
身体に悪い
(気候)an unhealthy climate―(食物)―unwholesome food―(空気)―insalubrious air
強度の光線は目に悪い
Intense light is bad for the eyes―injurious to the eyes―It hurts the eyes.
熱い物は胃に悪い
Hot things are bad for the stomach―They injure the stomach.
過激な運動は心臓に悪い
Violent exercise is bad for the heart―injurious to the heart―It injures the heart.

content: 5. (=何々するのは悪い)(It is) wrong (to do so)

content.content: 嘘を言うのは悪い
It is wrong to tell a lie.
(どうしよう)嘘をついては悪いし
It would be wrong to tell a lie.
君は嘘をつくのは悪いよ
It is wrong of you to tell lies―You ought not to tell lies.
君は人に依頼するのが悪い
It is wrong of you to depend on others―You ought not to depend on others―You depend on others, which you ought not to.
君達は英語を使わないのが悪い
It is wrong of you not to speak English―You ought to speak English―You do not speak English, as you ought to.
手紙を開けて見ても悪くはあるまい
It can not be wrong to open the letter―There can be no harm in opening the letter.
慰みに鳥を撃つのは悪くないものか
Is it not wrong to shoot birds for amusement?―Is there no harm in shooting birds for amusement?
子どもにこんな本を読ませるのは悪い
It is wrong to place such books in the hands of children―One ought not to place such books in the hands of children.
断らないと悪い
It would be wrong not to tell―We ought to tell.

content: 6. (=どうしたのが悪い)(One has) done wrong (in doing so)

content.content: 君は嘘をついたのが悪い
You have done wrong in telling a lie―It was wrong of you to tell a lie―You ought not to have told a lie.
金を返さないのが悪い
You have done wrong in not paying him―It was wrong of you not to pay him―You ought to have paid him.
君は彼を打ったのが悪い
You have done wrong in striking him―It was wrong of you to strike him―You ought not to have struck him.
謝らなかったのが悪い
You have done wrong in not apologizing―It was wrong of you not to apologize―You ought to have apologized.
そのことを僕に隠しておいたのが悪い
You have done wrong in concealing the matter from me―You ought not to have kept the matter a secret from me.
あんな人を信用したのが悪い
You have made a mistake in trusting such a man―You ought not to have trusted him.
僕が悪けりゃ勝手にしろ
If I have done wrong, make the most of it.
悪いと知りつつ金をやった
I gave him the money, knowing that I was doing wrong―against my better judgment.

content: 7. (=どちらが悪い)(Which is) in the wrong

content.content: 君の方が悪い
You are in the wrong.
こちらが重々悪い
We are very much in the wrong.
こちらが悪いのだから何と言われてもしかたがない
We are in the wrong, so we must put up with whatever they may say.
いったい誰が悪いのだ
Who on earth is in the wrong?―in fault?―to blame?
僕が悪かった
I am in the wrong―I am in fault―I am to blame.
彼は自分が悪かったと言って謝った
He says he has been in the wrong―He has acknowledged his error.

content:
8. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 悪いようにはしないから(安心し給え)
I have done everything for the best―I shall do everything for the best.
君は悪い方へ気をまわすね
You have a dirty mind.
悪い方へ気をまわさせるような言葉
a word with a double meaning
こう言うと人は悪い方へ気をまわしそうだね
The word has a double meaning.
悪いところを見つかった
I am fairly caught―You have caught me.
悪い物が降ってきました
It has begun snowing.
まんざら悪いこともない
It is not altogether amiss.
惚れられてまんざら悪い気持のする人もあるまい
No man will feel altogether displeased at being loved.

content: 〈接続詞、前置詞相当〉(=何々すると悪いから)(for fear) lest; for fear (of); in case

content.content: 落第すると悪いから勉強し給え
You must work hard, lest you should fail―for fear you may fail―for fear of failing.
見つかると悪いから用心しろ
You must take care, lest you should be discovered―for fear you may be discovered―for fear of being discovered―in case you should be discovered.
雨が振ると悪いから傘をお持ちなさい
Take an umbrella with you, lest it should rain―for fear it may rain―for fear of its raining.

わるいじ〔悪意地〕
〈名〉Ill-nature; spite

わるがしこい〔悪賢い〕
〈形〉Cunning; crafty; wily; guileful; astute; subtle; artful

content:
わるぎ〔悪気〕
〈名〉Malice; ill-will; an evil intention

content.content: 彼は口は悪いが悪気は無い
He has a foul tongue, but he means no harm―means no offence.
悪気の無い男だ
He is a harmless fellow.

content:
わるく〔悪く〕
〈副〉
1. Badly; ill; amiss

content.content: まんざら悪くもない
It is not altogether amiss.
惚れられたのはまんざら悪くもあるまい
You will not feel altogether displeased at being loved.
一杯飲んでも悪くない
A glass of wine does not come amiss―I don't mind having a drink―I have no objection to a drink―I could do with a drink.
悪くなる
to become worse―change for the worse―take a turn for the worse―deteriorate―(食物なら)―Pickles go bad―Eggs spoil―Meat or fish taints―Milk turns sour.
病人が悪くなった
The invalid has grown worse.
だんだん悪くなる
He grows worse and worse.
日増しに悪くなる
He grows worse and worse every day―daily grows worse.
悪くなるばかりだ
He goes on growing worse.
病気が悪くなった
His illness has taken a turn for the worse―taken an unfavourable turn.
景気が悪くなる一方だ
The times go on growing worse.
あの学校の先生が悪くなった
The teachers of that school have changed for the worse.
病人は温泉へ行ってかえって悪くなった
The invalid is only the worse for his visit to the hot spings.
天気が悪くなった
The weather turns out bad.
あの女は器量が悪くなった
She has lost her good looks―fallen off in her beauty.
漬物が悪くなった
The pickles have gone bad.
牛乳はじきに悪くなる
Milk soon turns sour.
雷が鳴ると牛乳が悪くなる
Thunder turns milk sour.
暑い時は卵や肉や魚が悪くなる
In hot weather, eggs spoil―meat taints―fish taints.
卵が悪くなった
The eggs are spoilt.
魚が悪くなった
The fish is tainted.
食物は悪くなりやすい
Food is apt to taint―apt to spoil―apt to go bad―Food taints easily―spoils easily―(商業界では)―Foodstuffs are perishable goods.
悪くなった
(食物)spoilt food―tainted food―(卵)―spoilt eggs―(肉)―tainted meat―(魚)―tainted fish―(牛乳)―sour milk
この卵は一週間くらい置いても悪くはならない
These eggs will not spoil with keeping a week or so.
悪くならないように冷蔵庫へ入れておけ
Keep it in the ice-safe to prevent its tainting.
胸が悪くなる
I feel nausea―feel queasy―feel sick.
見ると胸が悪くなる
The sight is nauseating―sickening―disgusting―My gorge rises at the sight―My stomach turns at the sight.
あの男を見ると胸が悪くなる
He is a disgusting fellow―He disgusts me.
悪くする
to make anything worse―deteriorate―injure―impair―corrupt
あの医者にかかってかえって悪くされた
His treatment has made me worse.
身体を悪くする
to injure one's health―impair one's health―make oneself ill
あまり勉強すると身体を悪くするぞ
If you work too hard, you will make yourself ill―(一声に言えば)―You will work yourself ill.
気を悪くする
to feed hurt
こんな小説は風儀を悪くする
Such novels corrupt the morals of the people.→『わるくすると〔悪くすると〕』
悪く思う
to think ill of a person―have a bad opinion of a person―take anything ill―take anything amiss―take anything in ill part
人に悪く思われたくない
I don't like to be ill thought of by people―I don't wish to have people think ill of me.
あの人に悪く思われてもかまわない
I don't care (a fig) about his bad opinion of me.
かく申すのは老婆心だから決して悪く思って下さるな
I say this out of kindness, so you must not take it ill―take it amiss.
悪く言う
to speak ill of a person―talk against a person―cry down anything―run down anything―decry―abuse―revile―depreciate―disparage
人のことを悪く言うものでない
You should not speak ill of people.
人のことを蔭で悪く言う
to speak ill of a man behind his back―backbite one
面前で人を賞める者に限って蔭で悪く言う
A man who praises you to your face, will speak ill of you behind your back.
居ない人の事を悪く言うな
Never speak ill of the absent―“Nil nisi bonum.”
お国を悪く言われて黙っておれない
I can not allow my country to be run down―I will not have my country run down.
悪く言えば詐欺だ
Give it a hard name, and it is fraud.
この果物は悪く甘い
This fruit is too luscious.
この料理は悪くしつこい
This dish is too heavy.
あの男のふうは悪くしつこい
His manners are too oily―too greasy―too unctuous.
この肉は悪く油濃い
This meat is too fatty―to rich.

content:
わるくすると〔悪くすると〕
〈副〉I fear; I am afraid

content.content: 悪くすると落第だぞ
I am afraid lest I should fail.

content:
わるくち〔悪口〕
〈名〉Abuse; sarcasm; scandal; calumny; slander; vituperation; (malicious or insulting) remarks:(反語にては)compliments

content.content: 悪口を言う

(人に向かってなら)to abuse one―revile one―rail at or against one―call one names―call one by hard names―make insulting remarks―(蔭でなら)―speak ill of one (behind one's back)―backbite one―stab one in the back―talk against one―whisper against one―calumniate one―slander one―make malicious remarks―throw dirt at one―pick one to pieces―pull one to pieces―talk scandal―make free with one's fame―take liberties with one's reputation
人の悪口を言うものでない
You should not speak ill of people.
あの男は蔭で悪口を言う
He will speak ill of you behind your back―He is a backbiter.
彼は僕のことをそんな悪口を言ったか
Did he say such things of me?
彼は僕に向かっていろいろな悪口を言った
He called me names―called me by hard names.
僕に向かって失敬な悪口を言った
He made insulting remarks to me.
口に任して悪口を言った
He called me by every name he could lay his tongue to.
僕は悪口を言われても平気だ
I am indifferent to abuses―quite used to malicious remarks.
悪口を言われても怒らない
I can take a joke in good part.
君はそんなことをすると人が悪口を言うぞ
If you do such a thing, people will make remarks―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your conduct will elicit malicious remarks.
うっかり人の悪口を言ってひどい目に逢った
I indulged in some remarks, which cost me dear.
あの人ほど悪口を言われた人はあるまい
No man has been more talked against than he.
成功する者は多少悪口くらいは言われるものと覚悟しておらにゃならぬ
A successful man must be prepared to have some dirt thrown at him.
学校の悪口を言う者がある
Some people take liberties with the reputation of the school.
会員がストーブのまわりに集まってひどい悪口を言っていた
The members were gathered about the stove, talking infinite scandal.
彼らが寄るときっと人の悪口だ
They can not come together without picking their neighbours to pieces.
彼らはありとあらゆる悪口を言い尽した
They have left no calumny unspoken.
有ること無いこと人の悪口を言う
They calumnize people.
あの人は雇い人の食物まで積るというがしかしそれは悪口だ
He is said to stint his servants in their meals, but that's calumny.
昨日は君の悪口を言ったぜ
Were your ears burning yesterday?
口汚い悪口
foul abuse―scurrilous abuse
口汚い悪口を言う
to use foul language―use filthy language―use scurrilous language
口汚い悪口を言う人だ
He is foul-tongued―foul-mouthed―a scurrilous reviler.
皮肉な悪口
cynical remarks
痛い悪口
scathing sarcasm
(女の)爪を隠した悪口
feline amenities
悪口屋
a scandal-monger
悪口学校
a school for scandal

content:
わるさ〔悪作〕
〈名〉Mischief; roguery; devilment(以上は抽象名詞):(普通名詞に用いれば)a prank; a trick; a practical joke; a devilry; a deviltry:(=する)to do mischief; to get into mischief; to play a trick on (one); to play a prank on (one); to play a practical joke on (one)

content.content: また悪さか
You are in mischief again.
君は始終悪さばかり考えているね
You are always bent on mischief.

content:
わるじゃれ〔悪洒落〕
〈名〉A practical joke; a low trick

content.content: 悪じゃれをする
to play a practical joke on one―play a low trick on one

content:
わるずれ〔悪擦れ〕
〈名〉Sophistication:(=する) to become sophisticated

content.content: うちの女中は山出しで悪擦れしていません
Our servant girl is fresh from the mountains and quite unsophisticated.

content:
わるだくみ〔悪巧み〕
〈名〉An evil design; a wicked design; a dark design; an evil scheme; a sinister scheme; an intrigue; machination

content.content: 悪巧みをする
to devise an evil design―revolve an evil scheme―concoct schemes―machinate―intrigue
彼の悪巧みに掛かった
I fell a victim to his schemes.
悪巧みをあばく
to expose an evil design

content:
わるぢえ〔悪智慧〕
〈名〉Cunning; craft; guile; wile; subtlety:(=ある) cunning; crafty; guileful; wily; subtle; astute; artful

content.content: 悪智慧を付ける
to put one up to a trick

わるどめ〔悪留め〕
〈名〉(A woman of the town's) detaining (a leaving lover):(=する) to detain (a leaving lover)

content:
わるびれる〔悪びれる〕
〈自動〉To behave unseemly; to be timid; to be abashed; to act the coward; to show the white feather

content.content: 悪びれるな
Be a man!―Play the man!
敵に臨んで悪びれた振る舞いをするな
Do not behave unseemly―show the white feather―in presence of the enemy!
彼は少しも悪びれずに試験官の前に立った
He stood unabashed before his examiners.
彼は少しも悪びれた様子が無い
He is quite unabashed―He does not show any unseemly behaviour.

わるふざけ〔悪巫山戯〕
〈名〉A prank; a practical joke:(=する) to play pranks on (one); to play a practical joke on (one)

content:
わるもの〔悪者〕
〈名〉A knave; a rogue; a rascal; a scoundrel; a villain; a blackguard

content.content: 僕が一人悪者になっていよう
I will bear all the blame.
悪者の真相をあばく
to expose a villain―unmask a villain

わるよい〔悪酔い〕
〈名〉The effects of wine:(=する) to suffer from the effects of wine

content:
われ〔我〕
〈代名詞〉I; we; myself; oneself; self

content.content: 形勢我れに利あらず
The day goes against us.
我れを忘れる
to forget oneself―lose oneself (in admiration)―be lost (in admiration)―be absorbed (in study)―be engrossed (in one's business)―be beside oneself (with joy or grief)
瞑想に耽って我れを忘れる
to lose oneself in a reverie
皆我れを忘れて嘆賞している
Everybody is lost in admiration.
彼は我れを忘れて読書に耽っている
He is absorbed in reading.
我れを忘れて専門に夢中になっている
He is engrossed in his profession.
我れを忘れて悦んでいる
He is beside himself with joy.
我れに帰る
to come to oneself―be oneself again
我れに帰った心地がする
I feel myself again―I feel quite myself.
彼は死が眼前に迫らなければ我れに帰らぬ
He is never himself until death stares him in the face.
我れながら驚いている
I am surprised at myself.
この出来には我れながら感心している
I admire the performance myself.
我れとはなしに(我れならず、我れ知らず)叫んだ
I shouted in spite of myself.
我れと我が喉を突いた
He cut his own throat.
火事と聞いて我れも我れもと出口の方へ押し寄せた
At the cry of “Fire!” they vied with one another in gaining the door.
我れも我れもと入学した
They strove with one another to enter the school.
人は人、我れは我れ
“Live and let live”―“Everybody to his own humour.”
彼も人、我れも人
“Man may do what man has done.”
俺は言わぬ、我れ言うな
“A guilty conscience needs no accuser.”

content:
われがち〔我勝ち〕
〈副〉Everybody for himself (and God for us all―and devil take the hindmost)

content.content: スワという時は我れがちだ
In the moment of peril, it is everybody for himself and God for us all.
我れがちに逃げた
They fled, everybody for himself and the devil take the hindmost.
世の中は我れがちだ
It is everybody for himself in the world.
火事と聞いて我れがちに出口の方へ押し寄せた
At the cry of “Fire!” everybody scrambled for the door.
戸が開くと我れがちに席を取る
When the door opens, they scramble for the seats―there is a scramble for the seats.

content:
われさき〔我先き〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: われがち〔我勝ち〕

content:
われしらず〔我知らず〕
〈副〉In spite of oneself; unconsciously; unwittingly; without knowing it

content.content: 我れ知らず吹き出した
I burst out laughing in spite of myself.
話に気を取られて我れ知らず乗り出して聴いていた
The story interested me so much that I was unconsciously leaning forward to listen.
我れ知らず間違ったことをしておった
I was unwittingly doing wrong―I had done wrong without knowing it.

content:
われながら〔我ながら〕
〈副〉Oneself

content.content: 我れながら驚いている
I am surprised at myself.
この出来には我れながら感心している
I admire the performance myself.

content:
われなべ〔割れ鍋〕
〈名〉A cracked pot

content.content: 割れ鍋のような声
a strident voice
割れ鍋にとじ蓋
“Every Jack has his Jill.”

content:
われならず〔我ならず〕
〈副〉In spite of oneself

content.content: 我れならず叫んだ
I should in spite of myself.

content:
われめ〔割れ目〕
〈名〉A crevice (in the rock); a crack (in glass or pottery); a chasm (in the ground); a rift (in the stratum); a fissure (in the stratum); a chink (in the door); a cleft (in the wall); a split (in wood); a slit (in the flesh); a cranny (in the wall); an interstice (in the boarding); a crevasse (in the glacier, etc.)

content.content: 割れ目ができる
to crack―cleave―rift―split

われもこう〔地楡〕
〈名〉A kind of burnet

content:
われもわれも〔我も我も〕
〈副〉Vying with one another; striving with one another

content.content: 火事と聞いて我れも我れもと出口の方へ押し寄せた
At the cry of “Fire!” they vied with one another in making for the door―they scrambled for the door.
我れも我れもと入学した
They strove with one another in entering the school.

content:
われら〔我等〕
〈代名詞〉We:(=の) our:(=を) us

content.content: 我れらの住むこの世界
this world of ours

content:
われる〔割れる〕
〈自動〉To break; to split; to cleave; to crack; to fissure

content.content: 皿が二つに割れた
The dish broke in two.
細胞が割れて二つになる
A cell cleaves into two.
牛は爪が割れている
A cow has cloven hoofs.
地震のために地盤が割れた
The ground was cracked by the earthquake.
卵は割れやすい
An egg breaks easily.
この木は割れやすい
This wood splits easily.
この胡桃はなかなか割れない
This nut will not crack―It is hard to crack.
氷が割れて水へ入った
I broke through the ice and fell into the water―The ice gave way, and I fell into the water.
頭が割れそうだ
I have a splitting headache.
二人の仲が割れた
Something came between the two friends.
尻が割れる
to be discovered―be found out
割れるような声でどなった
I bawled in an ear-spliting voice.

content:
われわれ〔我々〕
〈代名詞〉We:(=の) our:(=を) us

content.content: 我々の住むこの世界
this world of ours

content:
ワン
〈吠声〉Bow-wow

content.content: 犬がワンと鳴く
A dog bow-wows.
ワンと言え
Say “bow-wow!”

content:
わん〔椀〕
〈名〉A wooden bowl

content.content: 一椀の汁
a bowl of pottage
汁を椀に盛る
to serve pottage in a bowl―fill a bowl with pottage

content:
わん〔湾〕
〈名〉(大なるものは)a gulf:(小なるものは)a bay

content.content: 海は湾を成す
The sea here forms a bay―forms a gulf.
湾頭に港がある
There is a port at the head of the bay.
東京湾
Tokyo Bay.
メキシコ湾
the Gulf of Mexico

わんきょく〔湾曲〕
〈名〉A curve; curvature:(=する) to curve; to be curved:(=せる) curved

content:
わんげつ〔湾月〕
〈名〉A crescent

content.content: 湾月形の
crescent

わんしょう〔腕章〕
〈名〉An arm-strap; a brassard

content:
わんとう〔湾頭〕
〈名〉The head of a bay

content.content: 湾頭に港がある
There is a port at the head of the bay.

わんない〔湾内〕
〈副〉In the bay; in the gulf

わんにゅうする〔湾入する〕
〈自動〉To form a bay; to form a gulf

content:
わんぱく〔腕白〕
〈形〉Naughty; mischievous; prankful; wilful; wayward

content.content: 腕白小僧
a mischievous urchin―an imp―a scapegrace
この子は腕白盛りだ
The boy is now full of mischief―now an imp for mischief.

わんりゅう〔湾流〕
〈名〉The Gulf Stream

content:
わんりょく〔腕力〕
〈名〉Muscular power; physical strength; force; brute force; violence; the strong arm

content.content: 腕力に訴える
to resort to force―resort to violence
彼は口で負けると腕力を出す
When he is worsted in argument, he will resort to force.
遂に腕力沙汰になった
They finally came to blows―fell to blows―resorted to violence.
腕力で取ってみせる
I will take it by force.
腕力の制裁
fist-law
腕力の制裁を加える
to administer fist-law―take the law into one's own hands
腕力を養う
to develop muscular power
腕力なら君に負けない
I can beat you in physical strength.
土人は腕力で抑えつけておくよりほかは無い
The natives must be kept down with the strong hand.
腕力家
a man of strong muscular power―an advocate of the strong arm

ワンワン
〈名〉(Nursery name for) a dog; a bow-wow

content:
を
〈前置詞相当〉［注意］目的格、または種々の前置詞をもって表す。

content.content: 月を見る
to see the moon―look at the moon
人の顔を見る
to look a man in the face
人を笑う
to laugh at a man
人の手を取る
to take a man by the hand
人の勉強を賞める
to praise a man for his diligence
人の頭を打つ
to strike a man on the head
